Reviews.Title: “Not value for money.”
Reviews.Author: 712travelbug
Reviews.Content: We had the upgrade on a deluxe and it's no more than a hotel room. Quite small and stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: parrotheadgirl
Reviews.Content: Was offered this hotel as compensation when our travel agent mucked up so was a little dubious about what we would find however we were pleasantly surprised. Yes there is construction work going on close to the hotel however we didn't find it an issue other than one taxi driver who took a while to find the way in. The check in was fast, the staff very friendly and polite, the lobby attractive and the room was clean and comfortable. So although only an overnighter this time, would definitely choose this hotel again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: Mic213
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located on Bras Basah Road, which allowed us to make the walk up towards all the Orchard Road malls. The Balinese style pool was great to swim in and our room was clean and comfortable. My only complaint was the lack of free internet and they were charging SGD27 per day for a wired connection, which to me is unacceptable when so many other hotels in Singapore offer free wireless to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at Rendezvous!”
Reviews.Author: Linda D
Reviews.Content: So noisy that when the hotel staff member came to my room we could not hear each other speak! As the solution for the noise she offered me and my daughter EAR PLUGS!!! Yes, and I am paying $300 dollars a night! Get anther hotel! DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I wish I that I could add sound so that you too could hear the noise!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Cit-du-monde
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend who was visiting me in Singapore as who wouldn't rather spend a few days in a nice hotel than their apartment?! Centrally located by dhoby ghaut mrt, the hotel is modern and well maintained. The pool is very nice for a hotel so centrally located. Beds are very comfy indeed - bathroom amenities generous and good brand. The brasserie Balzac downstairs is also well worth a visit for the incredible value set lunch or dinner and excellent cocktails

Reviews.Title: “Good location but.....”
Reviews.Author: Rollinginthedeep
Reviews.Content: Been to SG many times and wanted to try and stays in a different hotels. Stayed from April 9-12,2012! Fast checked in and checked out. Have a nice and clean lobby. Got a room at the left side of the far end of 4th flr. It was a very clean room, decent size and a very comfortable bed. Now, here's the kind of negative side.... NO complimentary bottle water as the other hotels do. NO bathrobe or slippers which I dont really care. NO WIFI connection in the room which is a BIG deal for me (using IPAD!) They have LAN connection with Charges apply.:-( Had to go to the lobby for a wifi connection and charged me $S11.77 for 24hrs. Location? The best!!! Accessible to MRT and the bus station is just in front of the hotel. Close to the shopping paradise, Orchard Road. 10mins walk to Raffles City Mall and one of my favorite place... The Chijmes!!! So if you're in Singapore for shopping and leisure... This hotel is good for you. If you're for a business and cant do your thing without internet... You better think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: agentblond11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a club room (11th floor) for 3 nights. The rooms are very clean/tidy/furnished nicely. The only downside is they are quite small for club room. The restaurants in the complex are completely separate other than the cafe where you have breakfast - this means you cant charge your meals to your room. We went to the 'Full House' where the service was terrible - one meal was finished before the other arrived. Breakfast was included with our hotel and instead of having it in the club room we went to the cafe on the ground floor. The food is pleasant but I would recommend avoiding the bacon as it is rancid. Overall this hotel is in a great location perfectly positioned in the middle between little India and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good location, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JEmmanuelLasPinas
Reviews.Content: Good location very accessible to MRT Circle line and walking distance to attractions. Spacious rooms have been renovated. Bright public areas. Reception could be more welcoming though.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Shaun321
Reviews.Content: Building works around the hotel made difficulties for the taxi driver on way in, although to be fair, if he had followed the orange signs that I could clearly see, its not difficult so cannot put this down to the hotel, but was an inconvenience none the less. Check in was painstakingly long and I could see no reason for it. No queue, acceptable time - i.e. 4 pm afternoon. Concierge took my bag from the taxi then disappeared - I had to retrieve it myself from his desk and take it to my room. Room was fine, clean and decent sized. However a call to room service at 11.30 pm for a bottle of wine was met with the response that no alcohol is served after 11 pm, after expressing my dismay very politely, a bottle was delivered on condition I paid cash and no receipt was issued - very odd. The front restaurant/cafe fine for breakfast - although pricey unless included - far cheaper options lie just outside in Bras Basah Road. Bar/lounge lacked any atmosphere and was not a place I wanted to spend any time. There are better choices within the price bracket in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: 2509Jill
Reviews.Content: I could not recommend this hotel highly enough. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the rooms well equipped, clean and modern. There were building works going on in the locality, but work stopped at tea-time and resumed at a reasonable hour the next morning, so didn't cause any problems. Breakfast was comprehensive enough to suit all tastes and staff were, again, very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: lennywidjaja
Reviews.Content: Although there is construction outside, our room is noise free, window facing swimming pool. Aircon is ok, bathroom is clean, bed is quite hard, just the way we like it. We booked the room via Agoda, no breakfast, but just go down and exit from the side entrance, the Kopitiam is in front of you - open 24 hrs, 7/11, Wendy's, Subway, Starbucks and Coffee Bean is also near the hotel, no more than 5 minutes walk. Bus station and MRT Bras Basah/Dhoby Ghaut is just a walk away. Taxis are not hard to find, the concierge will help you to get it quick. I

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: stief53
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, just walk out and have fun! hotel completely renovated, very nice and friendly staff, good breakfast/ nice coctails. everything's calm and relaxed even if the hotel is fully booked, been here before for a copple of days, this time we stayed for a week, hope to come again.

Reviews.Title: “Plaza Club Room & Lounge”
Reviews.Author: Denise07012
Reviews.Content: (Paid single person occupancy rate SGD$314 / AU$233nt). Included in Club Room package were check-in at the Club Lounge, WIFI/Internet, welcome fruit platter, buffet breakfast, hot and cold drinks and snacks during the day, and cocktails and canapés each evening in the Club Lounge, plus I was granted a later 3pm check-out. On arrival I was upgraded to a larger corner room on the 11th storey Club Floor (unsure why). The bed was huge and very high (difficult to climb up into). There was a desk/work area in the foyer, chaise lounge, large flat-screen TV on a stand which swivelled around so it could be watched in bed or in the other area. The bathroom vanity area was in need of renovation, but the free-standing bath tub was new. Toiletries were very nice. The WIFI Internet was fast and easy to connect to. The Club Lounge was quite small and cramped, but the staff were genuine, helpful and very friendly. The food was of a high quality and attractively presented. The breakfast buffet in the Club lounge was small but you could order eggs and other items a-la-carte and it was sent from the main restaurant. Or, I had the option to have breakfast in Straits Café on the Lobby level. My room overlooked the construction work on Bencoolen Street for the new downtown MRT Line. This work was very noisy at times, but once completed in a year or two will add to the hotels attraction (being adjacent to the MRT). Some new eateries/shops are opening up within the hotel complex very soon and the hotels renovations are complete, apart from a couple of minor cosmetic touches.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence T
Reviews.Content: great service from friendly and attentive staff, a much enjoyed room upgrade (due to renovation works, i think), all room facilities working well and easy walking to all tourist points (orchard road, boat quay, clarke quay and marina sands) make this a good place to stay. weather was mild and so walking to sights was easy and relaxed. taking the efficient MRT from a nearby station also helped to easily get to other areas. location of this hotel is very central and makes it easy to do the tourist 'thing'. Being upgraded to a better room due to renovation works was also a bonus! Restaurant Tip : If eating at Jumbo Seafood restaurant, take the MRT to Clarke Quay where there is a brnach there. This will save a massive taxi fare if going to the one at Eastcoast Park. Taxi fares are costly due to addition of taxes.

Reviews.Title: “visited Feb 2012”
Reviews.Author: wescott195
Reviews.Content: Great hotel asked for the 3 hours free internet and it was switched on np. ideal spot for everyting MRT, bus orchard road etc. 3 mins from Raffles close to 7-11etc. food in the hotel front restaurant / cafe is cheaper after 5 in the afternoon but there is a 24hr food court next door and breakfast of 2 eggs toast and coffee is £1. Gym is great has its own showers and towels .Pool is small but nice . late return flight out was greeted with a "No problem" and we were allowed to shower after a long day and they looked after the bags for us and arranged a taxt . Zoo is great can spend a day / evening there great place for a 1 week break. take an extra case for the shopping

Reviews.Title: “Did the Job”
Reviews.Author: Attapp
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly. Checked in at 3am and got upgraded which made for a great start! Reasonably priced. Clean and modern. Small pool, but a welcome dip at the end of the day. Re location - it depends on what you are after, but the Chimes (Restaurants/live bands etc) is only a 3 block walk away. If breakfast is not included walk one block towards Chimes (Ignore the Wendy and 24food court) and you come to the Art Museum. The Dome cafe is attached - a small gem that offers a calm environment from where to plan your day. Re construction outside the hotel. Yep its going on. But didnt intrude. But dont go here if you plan to try and sleep during the day!

Reviews.Title: “Nice mid-sized hotel worth considering ...”
Reviews.Author: Mark R
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for four nights in January 2012 and this is a great mid-sized hotel. The room rate was quite a bit lower that other hotels in the same bracket - usually that means disappointment, but not in this case. My room was clean, comfortable and modern. The bed was firm with good pillows. No problems at all with the room. The pool area is nice and they have a small, but well equipped gym that looks out onto the pool. It's pleasant working-out in there. (gym equipment = 6 modern cardio machines, multigym, free weights and a Smith machine with a decent selection of bigger weights). The service was great through-out and the staff very pleasant. The location is good for walking to the high-end shopping on Orchard Road and there is a Starbucks very nearby. The only down-side was the high-price of anything additional (breakfast, internet access, etc.). This added more than an extra night of charges to the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Totally fine, clean, central, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: saraht1987
Reviews.Content: Singapore is expensive, so my friend and I booked this place as it was reasonably priced. Very clean, nice bathroom, small room. Staff provided good service. Regarding location, in hindsight, I would stay closer to one of the Quays, as I thought the location was not that great. There was not much around at night near the hotel, but it IS close to the train which is fantastic! So its not too far to get to Orchard Rd or go by bus or taxi to Clarke Quay. One thing that did annoy me was that they were undertaking all these renovations, which we were not aware of, and meant that the lobby was very cramped and noisy all the time. But we were barely in the lobby so it didn't really matter I guess! Would probably hunt around for something else next time I'm in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: BRJ7
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for two weeks in november 2011.the road next to the hotel was closed due to some construction work and this in our opinion was the only issue with our stay.the reason being that whenever we came back to the hotel,some taxi drivers were not sure as to how to get to the hotel taxi entrance.otherwise,the staff are very helpful and courteous and its a brilliant hotel.the location is excellent with very good transport links,bus stops directly by the hotel and two mrt tube stations,bras basah and dhoby ghaut within 5 minutes walking distance.there is a 24 hour food centre,kopitiam next to the hotel too.orchard road the shopping belt is also located nearby.in our opinion this hotel is central to almost all places of interest.will definitely come back to this hotel if we visit singapore again. stayed here with my wife and 4 year old son. bj

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deb_from_Oz
Reviews.Content: When we stayed at the Rendezvous Hotel we found the staff to be extremely pleasant and helpful. It is in a great location. For us a close walk to the MRT (probably about 7 mins) and also close to Clarke Quay We were pleasantly suprised to be upgraded to a suite which was really lovely, a nice corner room overlooking the fast paced street. It is getting a little old in comparison to some of the other hotels in the City, but it all depends on what you want and what you want to pay. A hint..... check the pricing online through the usual agencies, but we found that by contacting the hotel direct, we got an even better price, to the point that none of the travel agents in Western Australia could match it, so check it out. We did not eat at the hotel, nor did we have breakfast included, as we have found that we prefer to make our own way around, and as sometimes we may be late risers it is better this way. We would definatley stay there again, mainly due to the location. However, we are the type of people who like to enjoy different experiences if we visit a city twice. I definately would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Singandpour in the Rain :)”
Reviews.Author: braincandy19
Reviews.Content: Visited Singapore over the Christmas season along with my adult children. Despite the rain we enjoyed a scrumptious Singapore sling in the hotel lobby bar, 2 for 1 special. Don't forget Raffles experience too, though. They were expanding the hotel and we could see the construction through the floor to ceiling glass windows. The addition of shopping complexes and more attached to the hotel looks promising. The mostly white interior of the lobby kept things bright and a bit sterile. Flute player added to the ambiance along with afternoon tea tried by many. It was a bit pricy so we obstained from tea event. Rooms were clean and bed comfy. Good security as you need key to even get up to the floor.. make sure most people in your party have a key for this reason. There is a restaurant located on the lobby floor and the breakfast had many choices , definilty multi cuisine.Food was adequate. It is included in your stay good deal!! For lunch and dinner we dined ,elsewhere, as there are many choices for gatronimic exploration in Singapore. The hotel staff were pleasant and efficient for the majority of the time, in my dealings with them. In terms of location it is a little off the city centre but not so far for taxi or bus /subway. Walking distance to Raffles, large mall, Singapore Art Museum and Museum of Civilization. Great place to stay!! I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for very nice degree of elegance and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Best. New Years Eve. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: hahn88
Reviews.Content: We booked a club room but during check-in we were upgraded to a suite with complimentary late-checkout - no complains. The suite is superb - we saw the fireworks from our window! Staffs on duty were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a little crowded but it was tasty. The hotel is located near (a few mins walk) The Cathay and Plaza Singapura, and conveniently next to the MRT. It was a very comfortable and memorable stay. Thank you! Will def return againn!

Reviews.Title: “Well placed, well priced,clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Philip B
Reviews.Content: This is a good Hotel for the price and it has everything that you will need. More than anything the location is great giving easy access to Orchard Road (walk) and the River...the Quays.... museums and other attractions. The facilities are good. We were upgraded to a Club Room having booked a deluxe room ( which I think may have been bigger). The room was a little short on space and if you have more than one suitcase you will need to use valuable floor space, or the desk to store any more. (Hence average rating for the room) However, the room is well furnished, as well as comfortable and yes there are mirrors and a sliding frosted glass door to the ensuite, and a most modern computer operated bidet/toilet. We were on the 9th Floor and it was lovely and quiet. An upgrade doesn't entitle you to the Club facilities.....but it might ensure a more comfortable stay. All the staff were very helpful and the opportunity to collect our luggage and have a shower before travelling to the Airport late evening although not unusual in Singapore, was freely offered. We stopover in Singapore at least once a year and will certainly return to Rendezvous again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for singapore.”
Reviews.Author: woody13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is being refurbished and we were upgraded from deluxe to club room. Rooms ok but would have a given a better rating except for a few things. For the price it should have included breakfast and I did have 2 rooms, to give it fair value formoney I asked about the Internet and told it was $11 a day, then I read the rendezvous policy in their worldwide magazine and found the commitment was to provide this free for 3 hrs along with free local calls.I asked the recep desk and was promptly given free for 3 hrs daily. Staff were good.Still charged for local calls but could be bothered to complain. Benlecoon St which has a number of hotels including BayView are experiencing a hard time as the road is closed for a long long time due to the new underground being built. With this in mind one should by calling direct get a good deal. Fair bit of noise going on and access restricted. Good location, for the rendevous and others in the area for local transport etc. 10 min walk to the heart of orchard or little india and about 20min to china town. Local 24hr food stall a 1min walk where you can get 2 eggs, toast ,chicken bacon, and coffee for breakfast for a total of $2.50c and ok.

Reviews.Title: “Your Rendezvous with Singapore starts here!”
Reviews.Author: lmitravel
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location just a few blocks away from all of the Orchard Road action. Easy to get to from the airport - MRT stop is a block away and taxi ride is quick and will cost you SIN$25 (US$19). Walking distance to everything - we stayed for 3 days and never even had to ride the MRT. Considering how pricy hotels can get in Singapore, this was a great find at US$160 per night. We just had a standard room, but it couldn't be better. There is construction going on outside (as of Dec 2011) but we could not hear anything in our room. Ordered room service once, the food arrived quick and was good (just a club sandwich and some drinks) - but was of course pricier (US$18 per sandwich) than if you were to have the same thing outside of the hotel. Breakfast was not included in our rate, so we chose to eat out in the city - an extra surprise meal in Singapore is a treat in itself - there are so many great restaurants. Can't say anything negative about the hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rendezvous”
Reviews.Author: BigBearLondon
Reviews.Content: We had two short stays in this hotel in Singapore. The first time we had a room with fully mirrored wardrobes lining one side of the room. Makes your lovelife a bit voyeuristic but not really great for believers in feng shui. The rooms are very clean. The pool is great and the adjacent small gym is of good value. The service is good and the location is near off two museums and orchard street. The breakfast buffet is overpriced (30 S$ per person) with average food quality. Overall recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: joannefer
Reviews.Content: THe hotel is very lovely (newly renovated), central to 2 MRT locations (Bras Basah and Dhoby Gout) and in front and side of the hotel, there were 2 bus stops in case you decide to take the bus instead. Very convenient and close to shopping areas, resto and close to orchard. The room is clean. The cons are the staff is not very warm (except for those night shift staff) , no free internet but you can go to Cathay Mall just across the hotel and free wifi!. Good hotel and will stay again. It also has gym, swimming pool and very safe. CLose to Kopitiam (24 hours), church and other areas of interest

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: burgermaster007
Reviews.Content: we stopped off in Singapore for 4 night as the first part or our 3 country stay, after what amounted to 22 hrs traveling we were looking forward to getting to our hotel for a freshen up and something to eat, got to say i was very impressed with my first sighting of Singapore, spotlessly clean, arriving at the Rendezvous as we entered the reception i was not over impressed, i expected something more i guess, thankfully this was almost the last dissapointment i got, the staff were exceptional, from checking in to leaving i could not fault the staff, nothing was too much trouble, the resturant served very good food, the rooms were top notch for this standard of hotel, ok its not in the hub of everything but it is in the centre of singapore so making it easy for getting around, the underground station just 1 min walk, and so easy to use, i dont think you would be dissapointed staying here, downsides, reception not impressive but i do belive this is about to be moved to the new area, the swimming pool gets little to no sun at this time of year, that's as bad as it gets, 9 out 0f 10 for everything else, singapore has so much to offer we cant wait to go back, would i recommend this hotel to my friends YES.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ptgan
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been to Singapore every year since 2007. And each year, we stayed in Rendezvous hotel. The location is unbeatable. Two MRT stations (Bras Basah and Dhoby Ghaut) are just minutes away. Kopi Tiam which serves a variety of food is open 24 hours. If you run short of supplies, a 7-11 store is right around the corner. The hotel itself is clean. Staff are helpful. And of course the chicken congee is simply delectable!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ringo_nz
Reviews.Content: This is a good modern hotel close to Orchard road and metro stations. I was upgraded to a club room, size was average (plenty of space for a solo traveler) but the room was modern and very clean and had everything you would expect in a hotel of this type. Some people may find the bed a bit hard but it wasn't a problem for me. The 'business benefits' package was good as it included unlimited internet and buffet breakfast every day which would have been expensive otherwise and the room rate I got was very good value for money. Breakfast was the usual hotel buffet style with plenty of Asian and western options. The pool and spa area was nice to relax in after a day of sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Very easy, very good and worth to money”
Reviews.Author: anaydin
Reviews.Content: We have spent 3 nights with my wife in this brilliant hotel. It is very easy to reach by metro and just on the edge of Orchard Road. Clean and quite hotel. We strongly raccomend it for single, copule and families.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, could do worse”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice enough, but it is lacking in just enough areas to make it only an average hotel. I stayed in a Club room, which was quite small and had some strange features--notably the heated toilet seat, which I accidentally switched on and caused me great consternation until I finally figured out what was going on. Who the heck would need heated toilet seats in a tropical country?! In addition, the bed is extremely high off the floor, which I found uncomfortable. Sound integrity of the room was not good, I could easily hear comings and goings in the hallway outside. Finally, I had a dinner in the Straits Cafe downstairs, and it was like a university mess hall--packed with what seemed to be a loud tour group gorging itself at the buffet. The food was above average, however. Having said all of that, it is a decent enough place--they have put some effort into improving the hotel since the last time I was there a few years ago, and in a city of ridiculous hotel prices it's still a pretty good option if you don't want to shell out $500 to stay a night at the Marriott. Throw in the fact that it's only a block away from the Singapore Art Museum (which I keep promising myself that I'll visit some day!) and this makes a decent option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pazza71
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were excellent and very helpful. The location is near public transport,shopping and local food.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: contactwaqas
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is the biggest attraction. Staff is cooperative. You can access two MRT stations which are near to the hotel. Rooms are OK. I would rate average because the rate they charge is not worth off. I stayed for twenty days and the hotel put the fruit basket only once. There should be some more courtesy towards guests.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, friendly staff but uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: travelingmike167
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to location, close to 2 metro stops. Staff were friendly, but English did not seem like their primary language. Had an issue with my shower flooding and it took several minutes and multiple explanations so that the staff understood the situation. Room was small by US standards, but typical of Asia. Bathroom had one of the nice fancy toilets with the heated seat and bidet nozzle. Shower was nice with a wand and an over head rain head (though did have an issue with the drain being clogged initially). The bed however was atrocious. I like a firm mattress but this was almost like sleeping on the floor. This alone made me not able to recommend this hotel. Plus there are several hotels in the area that offer more services (free calls, drinks, breakfast, ect.) fro only slightly more money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: wendysanti
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights at the hotel last month when we relocated to Singapore (temporary accommodation). The rooms are an okay size but the hotel has been recently renovated so the decor is quite modern and bathrooms very spacious and clean. The restaurant downstairs is an okay breakfast option with good variety, but you are better off heading across the road to the 24hr Kopitiam food court where it is dirt cheap and you have choices galore (there is also a Wendy's, Coffee Bean and an Irish Pub). The amenities are quite basic otherwise but albeit adequate - small gym, outdoor pool and spa. There is a bus stop right at the front of the hotel with an array of options to get you to most tourist destinations. The Bras Basah station (circle line) is a short 40m across the intersection with Dhoby Gaut (main interchange) around a 10 minute walk north of the hotel. There is also a large number of shopping options nearby with a Carrefour located in the Singapura next to Dhoby Gaut. For the price they charge, you can't get much better bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tia_and_Esa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Rendezvous in October on our way to Thailand. The hotel is very well located, close to Dhoby Ghaut MRT. You can easily travel everywhere, which was convenient for us as we travel with a baby. The hotel is being renovated at the moment, but this didn't disturb us. Our room was deluxe: comfortable and clean and there was enough space for us all. Considering Singapore standards, it was big. Nice bathroom with a tub! Breakfast was good, not excellent, Asian and Western options available. Besides the breakfast I wouldn't recommend the restaurant, the food is just ok. You can get excellent food from the food court just across the street, Kopitiam, and a lot cheaper. This hotel is good value, basic but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: MomCeeManila
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed in Rendezvous and it delivered! Very strategic location (MRT, bus stop, church, places of interest) but not crowded. Spacious and clean rooms. Very courteous and helpful staff, particularly the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “great location in city centre with proximity to most of the attractions”
Reviews.Author: trushit
Reviews.Content: stayed in the hotel for almost 3 weeks on business trip and the greatest thing about hotel is its proximity to key places to see in singapore. Though undergoing renovation which was about completion in october, hotel was well maintained with good friendly staff and service. However, the standard rooms are relatively smaller...but thats the case with many of the good hotels in Singapore in this price range. PROS: * located in city centre on Bras Basah road which is near to orchard road shopping area, little India, mustafa and singapore museum....all at walkable distance of 5 to 15 min. * 5 min walk to MRT stations Dhobi Ghaut and Bras Basah...giving you option to go in different directions for your travel.....as well as bus stop right outside the hotel gate. * the beautiful clarke quay where you can get all variety of food and river cruise is just one stop in MRT or 5-10 min by taxi....a must visit place at night time * 2 stops by MRT to suntec mall and singapore flyer or marina bay sands * bang opposite to a 24*7 food court...but few options if you are a vegetarian CONS: * the high price doesnt include breakfast, mineral water bottle or even internet....and no wifi for standard rooms * rooms on road side can be quite noisy at night times due to trafiic * ordinary pool area * expensive food and beverages MUST DO/SEE IN SINGAPORE: * eat original kaya toast...its delicious and so cheap and yet filling!! * jurong bird park is a must...wont see all the beautiful birds in one place (needs 4 hrs at least to go around inside) * Asia's largest fountain at suntec mall...and you may get some good shopping deals as well inside the mall * take a trip to sentosa and back to mountain via jewel box ropeway...dolphin show inside sentosa is quite interesting * roam around shops/malls in orchard road....and buy if you can afford it ;) * eat various cuisines at clarke quay and take a river ride in the night to enjoy singapore AVOID: * must avoid buying anything from 7*11 store....very highly priced...even bottled water is priced double!! * marina bay sands observation deck...access only to a very small observation space on top of hotel...high entry fees not value for money

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: huow
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at RendezVous hotel and did have a very pleasant stay there. The hotel was still under renovation until November but wasn't really an issue to me as I spend most of the time out. Prior my arrival I emailed the hotel my room preferences. The hotel replied quickly that they acknowledged my request and would do their best. At check-in I was given a room I expected...great! The room was large enough for 2 adults, quiet and comfortable. The double bed was hard but comfortable. There are a minibar, an ironing board, a safe that fits a 15" laptop. Internet is chargeable with a different rate for either wired internet or wireless internet. The bathroom has a large shower cabin but no bathtub. I found the staff was very professional, helpful and friendly. The hotel has great location: close to Bras Basah station (circle line) and less than 5 min walk from Dhoby Ghaut station, a junction of 3 mrt lines. Also hop-on hop-off buses stop there. Opposite the hotel, there is a 24 hour Kopitiam. At walking distance there are Bugis market, Arab street, Little India and also one end of Orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “Rendezvous Hotel, Singapore”
Reviews.Author: AlvinAgustin
Reviews.Content: Most Singapore hotels I've stayed in have notoriously small rooms. The newly renovated Rendezvous Hotel located on Bras Basah Road was a welcome relief! Location is great, too. Just a 2 minute walk to the MRT station and the bus stop's right outside the hotel. Although our package did not include breakfast, it was not a problem as the 24-hour Kopi Tiam food court was just across the road. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LizR0n
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Enjoyed a club room and the benefits. Prices are very expensive and was dissapointed with the size of the room. We found the heated toilet seat very amusing. Staff very helpful and pleasant and breakfast was extensive. Great location for catching bus or train. Orchard Rd and Little India within walking distance or a short bus ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and rooms; not so keen on breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MrCushtie
Reviews.Content: Visited Singapore for a friend's wedding, stayed here for a few nights. Rooms are a very decent size for Singapore, with a good sized shower and ample wardrobe space. Bed was comfortable, soundproofing good (ie we weren't disturbed by noise from any other guests). The swimming pool was being renovated while we were there, but looks like it would be a good amenity when it is available. Location is pretty good - right at the end of Orchard Road, and with the National Museum of Singapore within walking distance. There's a bus stop just over the road that will take you all the way to the zoo, so it's well served for connections (as if there's many places in Singapore that aren't) Staff - variable. The front desk and the doorman were very helpful, but I felt the people working in the restaurant were rather brusque; maybe that's a Singaporean thing, but it didn't feel as though that was in evidence elsewhere. Breakfast in the hotel is pretty expensive for what it is; I didn't realise that ordering just a pastry and a coffee would be as pricey as it was, although perhaps the buffet would have been a better option. There are various coffee shops in close proximity that will sell you coffee and some toast for quite a bit cheaper (and the restaurant is rather cramped, so that's one area I wouldn't really recommend).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: baroquebabe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally placed in the Arts Precinct on Bras Basah road (which is at the eastern end of Orchard road). It was also convenient being in between Bras Basah and Dhoby Ghaut stations, making it easy to get anywhere we needed to go. We were able to walk to Bugis Night Market and Orchard Road, and were just a couple of train stops from the Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay, and a short train ride to the Sentosa Island. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Since our room wasn't ready when we arrived, the concierge looked after our bags while we went and had a coffee, as the reception staff arranged to have our room ready within 90 minutes. Rooms were quiet even though there were renovations going on while we stayed. Pool and restaurant looked great, although we didn't have time to use them.The only downside is that there was no complimentary wifi, but we were able to access this at a nearby shopping centre and cafe. Less than 5 minutes walk away was a 24 hour food court, 7-11, Irish Pub, Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf, The Cathay shopping centre, Bras Basah MRT station, Dhoby Ghaut MRT station.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: WoodyWestAustralia
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a 6 night stay at Rendezvous Hotel, the hotel is well located and the rooms are spacious and very nicely appointed. Upon check-in I was informed that my room had been upgraded to one of the Club rooms which I greatly enjoyed. A couple of points - I found the bed to be extremely firm which took a couple of nights to get used to, even after the hotel added extra cushioning to the mattress. Also, small containers of fresh or UHT milk should be available for tea and coffee - powder creamer is okay for coffee but unacceptable for tea. I also had issues with the TV system initially not turning on and then failing to turn off. This took a couple of calls to reception to sort out. I also had some odd issues with booking this hotel through Bookings.com. Twice- and with 2 different card numbers - the booking was not carried out successfully resutling in me having to ring the hotel directly to confirm the booking which was carried out very quickly. I have to agree with other reviewers of this hotel that considering the room pricing internet access sould be included in the room cost. But failing that, free access is avilable around the corner at the Cathay shopping mall - enjoy a morning coffee and croisant at Starbucks and log-on at the same time. Overall I'm glad I spent the extra money for a room at this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joan G
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed this Hotel. Staff warm & very friendly. Wanted to change rooms and this was done efficiently & without any inconvience to us. Didn't hear much off the noise from the renovations (front of Hotel). We couldn't have asked fro a more central Hotel was easy walking distance to MRT, Orchard Road, Raffles, shopping etc. If you want to go that bit extra the Club Rooms on the 11th floor are the way to go but ask for King Size bed as these rooms are larger than the Queen Size. This also allows free internet, cocktails, drinks & nibbles 6-8pm (the chocolates are to die for) & American breakfast. Our room was spotless & every night we came in our bed was turned down. All in all a fantastic Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid until they are done with renovation”
Reviews.Author: Johan N
Reviews.Content: The hotel is under renovation. When I was there they had a crane lifting things up onto the roof in the middle of the night. The crane made a terrible beeping sound outside for a very long time. Costed me a large part of a nights sleep.. Stay away until they are done with the renovation. Also their internet access is very slow, and expensive. For me it was included, but I think they wanted 28 SDG$ per night. It was almost like I was back in the old 56k modem time. Forget any web 2.0 applications.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel to stay at during the F1 Grand Prix”
Reviews.Author: Daniel N
Reviews.Content: This hotel is positioned brilliantly so that it's not far to walk to get to the circuit, but far enough away from the crowds to avoid all the people traffic and road disruptions. The staff were all extremely courteous and helpful for our entire stay. Apart from one of my friends being served a lukewarm beer on one occasion at the hotel bar (which they apologetically replaced), the food and beverage was all of a high quality. Buffet breakfast was great too with omelettes, scrambled eggs and waffles made-to-order. A coffee machine was available for self serve refills. The only downside for me, as I was travelling only with my iPad, was lack of wireless internet in the room. This was strange given that I used wireless during a previous stay at this hotel, so I presume this is something to do with the renovations. Wireless was available in the pool, lobby and conference room areas at the slightly steep rate of $30 per day. Pro rata rates were available though. Pool area was nicely presented and the spa was heated to a perfect temperature with jets powerful enough to make a chiropractor weep. The renovations are really transforming the interior of the building in particular, and the rooms have received as much attention as the common areas of the hotel which is nice. Overall we had a great stay at Rendezvous Hotel Singapore and would thoroughly recommend it, especially to those considering staying here during the next GP!

Reviews.Title: “I really couldn't fault this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ccappa
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in early October whilst enroute to Dubai. From the moment we checked in til the moment we checked out we received fantastic service. All facets of this hotel have been covered. Immaculate condition (although upgrading works were being done in one part of the hotel), excellent service, friendly staff and the location is perfect. We stayed on floor 11 in a club room which allowed us exclusive access to a separete Club Room/restaurant on the top floor. Free internet access, drinks, food, private breakfast every morning, TV's etc etc. Paying that little bit extra is definately worth it and I highly recommend staying in a Club Room. Rendezvous Hotel is within 200m of 2 MRT underground rail stations as well as bus stops right outside. Would definately stay here again without a doubt - excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of total commitment, quality service that exceed much expectation”
Reviews.Author: Phebes
Reviews.Content: We love and enjoy going on vacations/quick getaways. So, my fiance and I had chosen the sunny island, Singapore, for our trip this time around. Surprisingly, Rendezvous Hotel, is a hotel which provides us with a feeling of luxury accommodation. The front desk staffs are full of zest eventhough noises from the refurbishments are going on during the day. The staffs still put on their smiles and provide good service to make us feel better. The room are clean, spacious and totally accommodating. The bed is comfortable too. The facilities/amenities in the room and hotel are all great but my fiance was not agreeable with regards to the pricey wired/wireless internet provided by the hotel. And also, the pricey minibar. However, overall, our trip turned out to enjoyable. And we will not hesitate to recommend Rendezvous Hotel to other people, family members and friends. Thank you for a unique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel in the Center of it All”
Reviews.Author: ksar1901
Reviews.Content: A pleasant and airy hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Rooms were nice and clean, and decorated simple. There was an IPOD dock - something that Australian hotels should look into (hello Intercontinental). Free Singapore newspaper. Prime location as it is close to MRT stop, Orchard road and Bugis shopping center. If you dont mind the walk you can walk to Haji Lane and Bali Lane for shopping, food, coffee and the Blu Jaz Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Will soon be perfect”
Reviews.Author: cyberasylum
Reviews.Content: Cannot complain about this hotel. Room rates are in par with Singapore standard. The hotel is very well situated and recently renovated. There are still works going on till december. Rooms are brand new with modern ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place in the center of everything!”
Reviews.Author: oscartist
Reviews.Content: The remodeling continues but the staff bends over backwards to keep things going smoothly. The rooms are very clean and the place is secure. The hotel is at the beginning of Orchard road and near the edge of little india next to Fort Canning Park and all of these places are within a walkable distance there is plenty of late night eating all around the hotel from the high dollar Chimes to the budget conscious Kopitiam.

Reviews.Title: “A good example for Europe....”
Reviews.Author: buonviaggio66
Reviews.Content: October 2010:We had to go to S'pore for business (shipping) all of a sudden.. All arranged by our local agent right there.We had to work quite hard and when we came back it felt so relaxing.All what you needed.From a perfect well varied breakfast in the morning to the fantastic room where you could relax with all you need.Very clean rooms and bathroom. Outside the hotel you did not really need to get far away from the lively S'pore city. Just around the corner or let say more or less connected to the hotel was a very nice English Pub with a smashing lovely waitress from Hammersmith,London. A nice swimming pool where we cooled down in the afternoon with good facilities to change your clothes. A room just around the corner of our room with free use of PC's with internet access which was very convenient for us. After our job very late evening we enjoyed our beer at the bar with a good service:not too exagerated as in some places where you take a sip of your glass or you look accidently at the waiter and you're being served.Noo we felt at ease and not observed as the way we wanted. We did not enjoy our dinner at the hotel as we came in very late always so I can't really give a fair comment on that one. Very kind and helpfull staff everywhere in the hotel. I must say a very good choice of our agency as well I can recommend this hotel to people who are travellers with a more then average budget and to businesspeople with high demands for a short stay.Maybe not fair ,but noting can compare with this hotel price/quality wise in Western Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky stay”
Reviews.Author: Travellerporirua
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore on an unscheduled visit due to a cancellation of my connection flight. Contacted Hotel Reservations counter at Terminal 3. I was offered a room at S$138/night. As Superior room was not available, the reception staff gave me a large Club room with great facilities and spotlessly clean with a bidet toilet. The amenities were superb.The shower was unique with many adjustments which I thoroughly enjoyed playing with. I spent most of the day lying in the bath tub and had 3 showers that day as outside of the hotel, it was very dusty due to renovation work. Yet, I did not hear any noise in the room, whioch helped me to rest well. Their restaurant offered a variety of dishes, well prepared and was gorgeous arranged on the plate. I am not sure if I could afford this usually expensive Club room another time; but I am sure to recommend this hotel to my business associates.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: WliaputsSbsp
Reviews.Content: It's right on top of the yellow-line bras basah MRT station, very close to red/purple/yellow dhoby ghaut station, and a nice 10 minute walk from the green line City Hall station. As for the hotel, the rooms are quite small but nice. It doesn't really matter though because you'll be out exploring nearby most of the time! I had to work during the day, but I went out in the mornings and evenings and walked around. Plenty to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Karifroi
Reviews.Content: What a nice place. Beautiful rooms and a very nice bed. Locatiion is also just perfect, as it is situated right next to a central MRT station "Dhoby Gaut" and on the end of Orchard Road and other central sights in Singapore. Apart from this it must also be mentioned that the staff, even cleaning, are very kind and attentive. Only negative to me though is, that there is no WiFi in the rooms and that it is very expensive to use in the lobby. Would have been classy to include this in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: jodi N
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 days and have no complaints. Renovation is going on but it did not bother me as I am out during the day. Rooms were of an average size but recently renovated and had appropriate final touch-very comfortable bed, nice bathroom amenities, all lights controllable from keypad by the bed etc. Strong points- Good service, comfortable room, everything is new, less than 5 minutes walk from Dhoby Ghaut and Bras Basah MRT stations. Walking distance to Orchard Road (up market area and designer shops), Bugis (great market, shopping malls, vegetarian restaurants, temple), Little India, Raffles hotel and shopping mall. During my stay in Singapore, I also stayed at the Royal Plaza on Scotts in Orchard. However, I strongly recommend Rendez vous due to higher standard of hotel and central location. One problem is that internet charges are high but there is access to internet in the next building at 1 dollar for 15 mins. Breakfast is also not included but there is a food court and a seven eleven store across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Construction Construction”
Reviews.Author: Upintheairtoomuch
Reviews.Content: I think that says it all. I think when it is done, it will be a nice place to stay! Stayed on the Club Floor which is nice as you get breakfast and some nice food at dinner too. All the drinks you can drink, and a nice lounge to hang around in with your colleagues. I am not sure, but internet is also included. The surrounding area is nice with food, convenience stores, shopping etc.

Reviews.Title: “right location with good services in singapore”
Reviews.Author: VishalShivani
Reviews.Content: the lobby are is small but well done up. the rooms are good and spacious , we were here for 02 nites . the breakfast at the hotel was good and the restaurant was also very well done up and the location of the restaurant is also good. the raffles , little india and orchard road are all walking distance from the hotel. the staff was very cooperative and services at this hotel were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Expect better after renovation completed”
Reviews.Author: keluargaku
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights. Check in is takes a little long time, but check out is express. Location is very convenient - across the road is Brasbasah MRT station, Kopitiam, seven-eleven (you can buy local SIM card for your mobile phone, only +/- SGD 7, compared with one at the airport cost you SGD 28). Orchard shopping sphere is only 15-20 minutes walking. Room is relatively small compared to its competitor, but since they're under renovation, you'll get newly-furbished room. Bed is comfy, shower is powerful. Bathroom amenities from f.c.u.k (love it !!). They provide sophisticated toilet-bowl with air-dryer, you can set the temperature of the dryer, the seat-cover, and water from the washer. Getting taxi from the hotel is not a problem at all. Breakfast is ok, with standard choice of food (western & asian) and standard taste.The only downturn is the renovation process which leaves thinner-like smell on the small lobby. Well, hope it will get better when the process is over !!

Reviews.Title: “Made our stay in Singapore memorable”
Reviews.Author: 2011Liz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 days and 3 nights. The location is very convenient. Around 10 min. walk to Dhoby Ghaut MRT station. Near Plaza Singapura. There is also 7-11 and Kopitiam wherein foods are very affordable and operate at 24 hrs. Their rooms are so clean and spacious. Buffet breakfast with lots of choices. There's also an evening cocktail, with unlimited drinks, choices of wine, beer, juice. Buffet food is also served during the evening cocktail. These privileges are included when we availed a hotel room: free buffet breakfast, unlimited drinks from 7am-10pm, evening cocktail, newspaper, wifi, towel, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap. There's an iron too inside the hotel room and bath robe. Walking distance also to Little India Tekka Market and Mustafa. Their Filipina receptionists are very approachable and nice to talk to. SAEx bus stop is at the back of the hotel at Prinsep St. You can go to Jurong Birdpark and Night Safari at SGD 4.50 bus fare. There's a hotel construction. But we don't mind that coz were out during the day.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean, safe and decently size rooms”
Reviews.Author: om10
Reviews.Content: RendezVous is perfectly located for a leisure visit to Singapore -- walking distance to the colonial district (Raffles Hotel), Little India and Arab street. It is also located by two major MRT stations (Bras Pasah and Dhoby Ghost) stations giving you access to three metro lines. The 7, 77, and 106 buses will also get you to the magnificent Botanical Gardens via Orchard Rd. The rooms are clean, safe and decent sized. The rooms have windows. The pool area and gym are really nice. Breakfast is not included. Surprisingly even though they have a major renovation project underway I did not hear any construction noise while sleeping. The one complaint I have is that they only have WiFi in the lobby and they charge $11SG for 24 hours. With the major renovation underway, there's only a sliver of an ad hoc space serving as 'the lobby' -- with a desk that at most two people can share with laptops to use the WiFi. Paying $11Sg for WifI access when you're crowded into a tiny, hodge podge lobby with guests checking in and out all around you seems lame. Cheaper hotels provide free wifi which seems an increasing norm.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: PaulD49
Reviews.Content: Unlike other recent reviews, my wife and I experienced no problems at this hotel. This is no doubt because we were there before the renovations started. We found this hotel to be really beautiful - there was a nice big reception area, we were warmly greeted and upgraded to a superior room. The pool was lovely and my wife really enjoyed being able to use it. We found the staff to be really friendly and helpful, but best of all was the central location. The Dhoby Gaut MRT station is a 5 minute walk, Little India is about a 20 minute stroll and the start of the Orchard Road shopping area is 5 minutes away on foot. We thought the hotel restaurant was a bit expensive so we ate at a really cheap self serve place over the road. We intend to return to Singapore next year and we will definitely stay at the Rendezvous again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints.”
Reviews.Author: SpirosK81
Reviews.Content: Everything was A-OK. Service was good and prompt, the room was beautiful and clean, and kept clean as well. The staff were very polite and helpful and the location rather good, close to metro stations, a mall, a cheap restaurant across the street and bars/pubs close by.

Reviews.Title: “superb service, good location”
Reviews.Author: barbecue
Reviews.Content: Situated within 100meters to the nearest MRT station, with bus stops in front of hotel, Hotel Rendezvous is less than 5 minute walk to Orchard Road, Singapore Art Museum, Singapore National Museum. Kopitaim, 24hours food court is just across the street. Hotel was under renovation but the service was great especially Mr. James Bacquirain of Strands Cafe. James did the extra mile by providing steady supply of ice packs and lukewarm water for our injured relative who slipped at Mc Donalds. With the personal service extended by duty manager Nereem, we will definitely stay at this hotel again in our next trip to Singapore. Congratulations for a job well done

Reviews.Title: “Rooms a bit small, but good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: justdabest
Reviews.Content: Good hotel service and not a bad location. Rooms smallish and old but have modern lighting controls and toilet warmer installed to compensate this. Comfortable hotel for a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “utterly disastrous”
Reviews.Author: china49
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 3 nights from 20th June this year. We were on a trip to visit family and booked the Rendezvous because we knew it had a good central location and a reasonable reputation. What we did not know, because it was not mentioned when we booked, and was not mentioned on the hotel website, was that it was undergoing "renovations". But we discovered soon enough. After a 13 hour flight from the UK we needed to rest. But that was impossible. I have never heard noise like it in a hotel room - it sounded like the drills were about to come through the ceiling, through the wall and out of the window the swimming pool cement was being dug up. It was horrendous. I can sleep through most things and was exhausted after the journey - but I was on the verge of tears. The hotel said the work was due to stop to 6pm which indeed it did - but started again the next morning. So it meant that the hotel was a no-go area during the day as there were no guest areas at all except for a pokey area with 3 chairs which operated as reception and a coffee shop. Nothing else at all. We checked out the morning after we had arrived and the staff were not surprised - must have been happening a lot. It was a battle to find another hotel room in a busy Singapore but we would rather have slept on our son's sofabed than go back to that place. The worst thing is that they did not warn us at all. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but the construction needs to end soon”
Reviews.Author: Aninm
Reviews.Content: We went on a family trip for 5 days. The staff was very helpful but the construction was maddening. The breakfast buffet was not bad but on the 4th day the approach to the restaurant was completely blocked by construction. there was also no handicapped access. Hence we ended up carrying our kid's stroller up and doen the stairs!! The staff helped us out whenever they could though. Also, we arrived very early (7am) but were given early check-in which was great. The location is fabulous. Bus station just behind the hotel (right in front of the back door). MRT station stone's throw away, Musuem across the street. A nice and affordable mall nearby - Plaza Singapura. Also, there is a 7 eleven close at hand and very much needed as they charge for water in hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Bad form and disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Sarasmish
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights in the Rendevous hotel from 18th July. I have stayed here before. I arrived to a crappy reception that is so unwelcoming. There was banging of construction. I booked this hotel as it has a pool only to find there is no pool due to renovations. Rendevous were happy to take my booking and my money without informing me or its other guests of these issues. I was offered to walk accross the road to the YMCA which was not an inviting offer. I am having medical issues and was really looking forward to relaxing by the pool in between Dr's appointments not walking a block in wet bathers. I am now in my room watching TV which has very little choice of programs unless one wants to pay $18 for a movie. The in house room service menu is very unimaginative and uninteresting and uninviting. No pool , lousy TV, boring and uninventive menu with few options for those who dont want meat or fried food.I had to go out to eat. Had I known there were renovations I would never have stated here. I find it unfair and unreasonable on the part of Rendevous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but.......”
Reviews.Author: montypython51
Reviews.Content: Although it was a nice hotel, our travel agent should have told us that the pool was closed and that there was noisy renovation work happening during the day. If I knew that it advance, I definitely would not have stayed there. I would certainly consider it for a future stay provided the pool issue and noise was addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but...............”
Reviews.Author: Ziauddin
Reviews.Content: I knew that it's a good hotel as I stayed here around 5 years back once. Booked the room through Asia Travel, but missed the information that renovation work was going on. So the hotel does not have a lobby now, a very small reception area and the swimming pool was closed. Lucky that the Gym was open. And definitely there was some noise during the day. However the staffs were extremely courteous, as before, and tried to make up for the situation. The room was good and also the rest of the things. But the finest point of this hotel is the LOCATION. Just beside the MRT (Dhoby Ghaut) station, bus service also runs just beside the hotel and there is a cineplex as well, probably Cathay. Overall, if the renovation work was not there it would be a great stay. May be they will be done by November this year, 2011.

Reviews.Title: “nice pick for a short stay in singapore”
Reviews.Author: pravet
Reviews.Content: we jus arrived from a little hectic trip of bali ....we reached the hotel at around 2 am in the night ......it was not a very pleasent welcome at the reception there were 2 people at the reception among which one of them was very sleepy of half in his sleep....i had already done my hotel booking through hotels.com till i remember....i gave him the credit card for his system update but he insisted on having a cash deposit also which i dint like it very much.....i had also requested the hotel before reaching if they could do something special in the room as i was there on my honeymoon .....but i did not get anything special treatment by the hotel ......i honestly booked this hotel because it was on the orchard road and little cheaper than other hotels on the orchard road .......the rooms were normal size ..around 20 mrts .....or 200 sq ft....the bathrooms were very small as it was expected for the city of singapore........we were given a queen size bed ....the bed was reallly nice n soft n comfortable .....the room had nice tv in it ....and the view was also pretty decent from the room .......the best part was that the bathrooms had soaps and shampoo's of chopard........in nice blue and differnet colours......there were some nice people also among the hotel staff as the next day when we got down to understand from this person at the concierge ...he helped us with the places to visit and he guided us the routes to go along ....he was a very nice and gentle person amont the staff...well i dnt remember his name other wise i would have mentioned it out here in my rewiew .......i was at the hotel only for 3 nights and it was good for the price .....when in singapore i would go back to the hotel but prefrebaly by taking a better room which is honestly a little bigger so its more comfortable ......and so i would also suggest my other frinds the same ....this place is more comfortable for stay since its near to shopping areas and also very conviently you can walk down the street to experiance the true singapore ...........on one side its the bencollom street and on the oyther there is the orchard street.............i would definately go back to the hotel since its much resoanble than any other hotels on orchard road and its a 4 star plus property ..........

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Craig_Ausie
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival with another couple with whom we were travelling, our rooms were upgraded to club rooms, but without any other benifits. We saw a note saying the swimming pool was closed, but that we could use the YMCA which was a few blocks away (not a reasonable expectation). We found there was no foyer as it was under renovation. The only place to sit and wait for our friends was a single 2 seter couch outside ofthe elevator. Whilst we could not hear much construction noise, our friends could hear it throughout the night. We were not informed of these things until our arrival. Had we been given the choice of a rate reduction, this may have been a reasonable option, but this was our first trip to Singapore and our freinds first trip overseas, having somewhere to sit and chat was in this case, sadly lacking. Were were also told that the in house travel consultant would be in a 9 the next morning, but they did not show up until the next day. So, it would have been a long wait,. The location was great, but overall, a dissapointing stay. I would not recommend this, because I believe were were purposefully misled by the hotel management.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will always stay here on Singapore trips”
Reviews.Author: richarajanya
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good and clean. The staff was very helpfull. The room was small but very cozy and had enough space for two of us to roam around. Good music on the TV. The pool of hotle was amazing and jacouzi was too good. Enjoyed our time at the hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - probably won't be able to afford it once it is refurbished”
Reviews.Author: SydGloucester
Reviews.Content: Booked this for a 3 night stop over on our way to Australia - particularly wanted a hotel with a pool as I don't usually swim at home. After booking, we had an email from the hotel to say the pool was closed for refurbishment. Thought about changing but so glad we didn't. The location was perfect for what we wanted. And we were upgraded to a Club room when we checked in. Really nice room and lovely white towelling robes. Really modern bathroom, photos on here don't do it justice as it is quite dark stone tiles, that don't show up very well. Only draw back was the underground is still being built and you can't buy tickets at every station (particulary the one closest to the hotel) and the staff didn't know anything about it. I'm sure this will change in time though. We will be coming back to Singapore and will certainly try and stay here again, but I have a feeling that once all the refurbishmens are complete, we won't be able to afford it. Very cheap meals can be bought at the Kopitiam across the road. Walking distance to Raffles. Taxis are really reasonable - don't think about travelling any other way from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfying...”
Reviews.Author: LuluGeelong
Reviews.Content: When we booked the hotel, we read in their website that they were undergoing renovation and the pool would be closed during that time. We went ahead with it anyway because the room price was discounted and the location is central and we don't go to Singapore for a swim... we can swim back home! At time of arrival, we were greeted by very friendly concierge and receptionist. Because I went with 2 young kids, the receptionist was very kind to offer triple room at the price of 2, which was very nice but unfortunately my kids wanted to sleep on the same bed with me. So I requested a big bed instead and we were upgraded to Deluxe room. The room is always clean and neat, thanks to the housekeeping team. And the bed was indeed king sized... so our 3 nights stay was very very satisfying. Also in every room, they have this international adjusted adaptors, so you don't have to ask for one anymore. Renovation noise only happened during working hours but it didn't bother us because we were always out during the day, by the time we came back around 5 or 6pm, it had stopped. In term of location, it's very central, you can walk everywhere to find everything... very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “great location, wonderful staff and lovely room shame about reno's”
Reviews.Author: katiebella_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a welcomed stay after a terrible very low budget hotel the night before. Upon arrival we were greeted by all staff from concierges to front desk staff and the service continued to be excellent from hereon in. The room was nice and although I noticed that a lot of people complain on here about the hard bed, my partner and I loved the bed, it was so comfortable but then again we have bad backs and like a firm bed. The location was fantastic, right around the corner from the National Museum and Art Gallery and the train station was only about 250m away. There is a 24hr hawker centre across the road so access to food is no issue. Most key sites and attractions were within walking distance or a very quick and easy train ride. We only had one night here but if you were staying longer and looking for a hotel with all the facilities you may be disappointed because there are renovations going on so a lot of facilities were closed/disrupted. I think though we were really happy with the place at the price we paid (nothing half decent is cheap in Singapore when it comes to accommodation), maybe the hotel should discount its rooms due to the disruption of the renovations and the lack of facilities open? I think the renovations will be finished soon though and my partner and I would certainly be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel you cannot trust, will never book them again”
Reviews.Author: FrankfromSydney
Reviews.Content: Only when we arrived we realised they were refurbishing their lobby and several levels. for a hotel that pretends to be a 4star one they should have notified people. If we would have know the state of this hotel, we would have booked a far better place for the same place. No compensation offers whatsover for the inconvenience ... summarised a pure rip off

Reviews.Title: “Worth About Half the Going Rate”
Reviews.Author: bwhealy
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend at the Rendezvous Hotel in Singapore for two nights last week. As an individual who has worked in hotels and is majoring in travel business, I believe that my scope of knowledge and hotel experience is pretty good. That being said, I have to say I was highly unimpressed with the Rendezvous overall. Let's start with the good: 1. Location: Very close to Orchard Road and several main Singapore attractions. 2. Room size: Plenty of space for 2 people. 3. Housekeeping: Did a good job of tidying our room and responding to our calls. Here's the downside: 1. The rooms are VERY dated - old furniture, hard mattresses, ancient bathroom appointments. 2. The rooms are DIRTY. (see picture of bathtub in our $250 a night room). 3. The front-desk manager is friendly, but the check-in staff on the front line only marginally so. Also, it took FOREVER to check out (15 mins.) 4. The hotel is being overhauled AND SHOULD NOT BE OPEN: a. No lobby: There are temporary walls up everywhere with cheap pictures of their other (seemingly nicer) properties. I see that the hotel is major need of some TLC, but the amount of inconvenience to guests warrants the hotel to be closed. b. The pool is closed. They give you a pass to the YMCA - not what I would expect for over $200 a night plus taxes. c. THE DRILLING: Was happening everywhere until around 6:30pm each day - and was LOUD LOUD LOUD!! This was unacceptable for 12 hours a day. d. The Internet, which was spotty, was S$26.00 PER DAY. e. One the on-site restaurants: closed due to construction. I was really disappointed by this hotel and would recommend you avoid it at all costs. I felt ripped off, and we actually were prepared to change hotels our second day if we could've gotten a refund for our second night. I don't normally slam a hotel like this, since I know how hard pleasing so many different types of travelers is. But, I can't say that a traveler from anywhere would be moderately impressed with this property. My recommendation: Check out the Marina Bay Sands (just over S$300 some nights and well worth it); look into the Ritz-Carlton (pretty, seemingly good food); avoid Mandarin Oriental (looks like an NYC Convention hotel, not a standard look/feel for that chain).

Reviews.Title: “Super location but check when facilities will be reopened”
Reviews.Author: Buster1980
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay at the Rendezvous. We were upgraded to a club room which was small but newly refurbished. The beds are very very hard but they did put another duvet under the sheet when asked. The concierge staff member who took us to our room was fantastic and so helpful but the rest of the staff were efficient and not over friendly. The concierge member who helped us leave was just unhelpful and rude. I asked him to confirm our flight time and terminal and he came back and handed me the Emirates phone number. When I asked if there was a pay phone around I could use, he said no and walked off. I was a little taken aback as all the other hotels we had stayed at would have done this with no problems. The wireless internet was approx SG$18 for 24hrs which is pricey. What we were most disappointed with was once we arrived we were informed that the pool and gym were closed. This was an issue for us as I had purposely booked a venue with a pool as this was the last 3 day stop of a two week beach holiday so we did want a bit of time to just chill by the pool. They did offer a YMCA pool and gym admission and towels to take but this is over two busy roads and the facilities there were just OK. But the location of this hotel was perfect, 2 min from the MRT, bus to attractions out the front (Singapore attraction express or SAex) goes direct to zoos and bird park) and not far to Orchard road and Raffles. The sightseeing bus also stops right outside the hotel. Sentosa is easy with a quick MRT ride to Harbourfront and then catch the monorail from VIVO city shopping centre to the island. I would recommend the hotel for business and leisure travelers once the upgrades are finished. It's location, amenities and club rooms are great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Staff. Very Expensive Internet.”
Reviews.Author: RoyalSilk
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a very pleasant stay at this hotel and the staff could not have been more accommodating. Well located close to Bras Basah station, it is also very conveniently located for a number of amenities, including the Singapore synagogue complex two blocks away. My only negative observation was the extortionate price for in-room (wired) internet at $S26 a day, which does not even then grant access to the wireless system – you have to pay extra for that. Nevertheless, I would recommend this hotel on account of the level of service and friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kel042
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying here, 250mt to MRT and walking distance to Raffles, Clarke Quay, China Town, Marina bay, Shopping centres though we did try to MRT/bus it one way and then walk back. Rooms are standard & clean, bed was a bit hard for us however that is all personal preference. We booked a club room which gave us breakfast and 2 hrs of drinks/nibbles 6pm to 8pm, free internet, tea,coffee and soft drink all day which was fantastic value and we didn't really need to buy lunch or dinner. (you can pay $16/beer/drink at night at Clarke quay). Breakfast was fantastic, though if you don't take the included option there is a food hall across the road for a really cheap alternative. The website is a bit deceiving though, I thought we had booked a room with a bath which we hadn't so be aware that the "deluxe club"and the "club room" are not the same thing. They are currently undergoing renovations and will have shops in hotel when finished Will definitely stay here again if we go back to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Magmaster
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a welcome place to rest after a long haul flight. We particularly liked the hot tub next to the pool. Spacious and really warm. The hotel was undergoing some renovation at the time of our stay (late Feb 2011), upgrading the entrance and the gym, but this did not affect our impression of the hotel. Clean, comfortable, and recommended. Great location as well. Raffles, the CBD and Orchard road are all within walking distance. The bus to the zoo leaves from outside the hotel, and the MRT is a very short walk away. Special mention to the front desk staff as well, who were only too pleased to assist me ring various locations when I discovered I'd misplaced my wallet onn my travels (almost certainly this was my fault - Singapore is a very safe city).

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: thedoctor46
Reviews.Content: stayed at the rendevous for 6 days arrived late saturday night, we were checked in in no time,one of the staff Eric took our bags,showed us to our room, mentioned if we need , food the kopitaam next door was 24 hours very cheap,good food sticky rice duck, beers ,all cheap, the rooms we found were very clean comfy, and quiet, had buffet lunch 1 day huge range of fresh fruits seafood, smoked fish and meats and salad, all wonderful friendly service, very close to MTR stations, Raffles, staff are very friendly and attentive and know their job,the whole time was great will be back for sure

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel Room, No sunlight on the pool”
Reviews.Author: NatSki8
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, and the staff polite- Although i was expecting a bit better for the money i paid considering it was very expensive. The room was very small, without openng windows and no balcony.The hotel is built around the pool meaning no sunlight is on the pool throughout the day, making it impossible to get a tan by the pool. The location was fantastic, and near all forms of transport and only a few minutes walk to the major shopping complexs and the main shopping street of Singapore. The buffet breakfast was nice and had variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sunseekers8910
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 5 nights at this hotel. Like most other reviews, we found this hotel to have a great location in Singapore. Close to 2 MRT stations and Orchard Rd. Rooms were clean and quiet. Hotel facilities were good. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice . . . .”
Reviews.Author: jatv
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here when the hotel offered us a special rate for our stay last year (buffet breakfast, unlimited wired internet and room good for 2 adults and 2 kids). Everytime we go to Singapore I was hesitant in choosing this hotel, but this time we opted to try it out. Though location wise its still within the vicinity of Orchard and near an MRT station, but can't be compared to the location of hotels like Meritus wherein when you go down the hotel you're really within Orchard. The hotel itself is clean and everything seems to be in order when we checked-in until we checked out, staff were courteous and friendly but not smiling at all times which I think is part of their culture. Though they extend an extra hand if you need one, like during our last day it rained hard and was soaking wet when we returned to the hotel, since we already checked out they offered us towels and a place to dry up. But one comment I have is that during one breakfast my son was disappointed since the rice they served was spicy (really spicy), hope they consider always having steam rice specially for the kids. Though its nice to taste new food but they should always have the basics specially to those who are not that adventurous in their way of eating.
