Overall had a nice stay and made a good choice, and would recommend this to friends and family if the price is reasonable like what they offered us. But there are lots of hotel in Singapore that I would also like to try on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well-located, good-value hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetheoutdoors2010
Reviews.Content: Conveniently-located hotel. Superior room on the 3rd floor was clean and quiet, and close to swimming pool. Good value. Helpful and friendly staff in reception.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Secure Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: MeetuNambiar
Reviews.Content: The hotel has nice big and clean superior rooms equipped with tea/coffee maker, TV, Fridge, Iron (with board) & Safe. The bathroom is quite clean, big and spacious with a huge bathtub and all bath supplies & towel replenished daily. Bed was very comfortable. Check in and Check out was very smooth and quick. The room service wasn't too quick though, plus inspite of repeated reminders they wouldn't keep more than 2 tea bags each day while replenishing the supplies. Apart from this it was a great and comfortable room. The view from the room didnt have anything to offer. The room was facing another building. The A/C was great with complete control. The hotel has 2 MRT's next to it, one is bras brash and the other is dhoby ghaut. The hotel is just next to orchard street and is surrounded by umpteen number of restaurants. Only negatives - there was no free high speed internet and breakfast buffet was very expensive and not included in the package. But still I would certainly like to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ECJackson
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel at 6:30 am from Dehli and the Reception staff were wonderful. By 7am I was checked into an upgrade room (without request) and comfortably settling into a much needed sleep for a few hours. Wonderfully quiet and I found all the staff pleasant and welcoming. The restaurant while more expensive than street fare was excellent. The only criticism was the exorbitant prices for the internet. But the staff directed me to an internet cafe down the road which was incredibly cheap. Have stayed in a number of Singapore hotels and this was great value for money and the location is fantastic, city bus just across the road. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: VadimMr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the middle of town, making it a very comfortable point to be at in Singapore. Close to couple of malls, metro station (Dhoby Ghaut), art museums, galleries, etc. The hotel itself, however, is a total disappointment. If you're expecting to get a friendly service - don't hold your breath - most of the staff is very (I'd say over) official and won't go out of their skin to help. You do get occasional smiles from concierge, or the ladies who clean the rooms, but this is it. To those who book without a breakfast - great move. There is plenty of good cafe shops, small restaurants and food court just near the hotel, where you can have a breakfast for much better price. Internet services are extremely overpriced, even for Singapore. If you're on a business trip, it might suit you for a couple of nights, but if you're a couple, or a group of friends, there are better options in town. Value for money - NO WAY...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in SIngapore”
Reviews.Author: Breamo
Reviews.Content: it is not easy to find a hotel with good value for money in Singapore but Rendezvous could be just the one. It is located conveniently near the MRT Station towards the east side of Orchard Road. The hotel must not be very famous as a couple of taxi drivers have not heard of Rendezvous hotel so having the hotel address would be quite handy. There is a nice Capitam food court opposite the hotel and you can get all sorts of food. Hainan chicken, noodles soup, desserts, special drinks, dim sims and the place is very clean and prices are very cheap. We have our teenage daughter with us so they have added a roller bed and it is actually quite comfy. So overall the room is quite good and the hotel felt secured. We wouldnt have any problems coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean rooms but beds were rock hard & hotel was a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: starswine
Reviews.Content: There is nothing really wrong with this hotel but the jury is still out if I would stay there again. The rooms were clean, reasonably roomy and well equipped. I liked that they provided a DVD player, a spacious shower, room safe and the room was properly cleaned by housekeeping. I did not like the rock hard beds (although my husband slept fine) and I did notice noisy neighbours coming back at around 2am and having a small party. I also found that the aircon did not stick to a consistent temperature so it was either too hot or too cold. The location of hotel was great - very close to key trains stations and walking distance from Orchard Road and the Raffles Hotel area. Nearby was also some very cheap, and good, places to eat - the hotel may have had great food but $38-ish pp for breakfast is a joke when you can cross the road and eat for $5.

Reviews.Title: “Three star hotel at best - but charging five star prices - never again!”
Reviews.Author: Aplchx
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? 1. Bathroom flooded everytime we took a shower 2. Air con was noisy when it was on 3. Remote control buttons dont work properly 4. Hotel had to be contacted numerous times to get the problems fixed. No apology for inconvenience. 5. Seriously expensive internet charges - no free wifi Terrible hotel charging exhorbitant rates for basic lodging. We will definitely not be returning nor recommending this hotel to anyone! 6.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MrB_MrsMac
Reviews.Content: Was very happy when I arrived to find out the hotel is totally non-smoking. Such a nice feeling not having to argue when checking in to get a non-smoking room. Room was very clean, nice firm bed and pillows. Fittings were nice with a nice sized LCD TV. Breakfast is great, buffet, with fresh eggs and waffles along with the usual suspects. Close to two MRT stations, both within 250m walk, and very close to the Cathy shopping centre. Pool was nice, quite cold, but great for a dip. The spa was very refreshing and set to a good temperature. Will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Colonial exterior hotel”
Reviews.Author: sugusmae
Reviews.Content: The hotel complex itself is quite big, and from the exterior looks quite an imposing colonial building. There are 2 entrances , the main one where there's a drive path for taxi's pick up/drop off, and the other entrance is a walk in from the opposite entrance where guest will pass by the middle open air "lounge" before entering the hotel. Check-in/check-out is a breeze, staffs are helpful. We reserved the standard superior room. Normal room size, cozy. Furniture is slightly dated, not by purpose to suite its colonial exterior! Heard that the suites are located on a newer block with newer furniture and are much spacious. Good selection/array of breakfast & quite tasty. Quite an extensive area to sit. There are also free cocktails at the lounge bar at the ground floor in the evening daily. Good location to dhoby ghout or bras basah station. There's a cinema nearby, and plaza singapura is a 10mins walk away where you can find more food (shopping complex food!) & entertainment. A good stay, but slightly on the higher side for the staying experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel at a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jpflies
Reviews.Content: Always enjoy my stay in Rendevous, as the locate is quiet close to everything you will need. Although some rooms look a tad out of date with only a floors renovated the amenities and staff are exceptional. The price for the accommodation is very reasonable and the hotel is great for either a business trip or for a tourist traveling with family.

Reviews.Title: “There're much better to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: dijap
Reviews.Content: The Hotel overall is a complete hassle. It's overpriced, charges fee even for the telephone recharge. We got upgrade to deluxe room - I didn't notice anything "deluxe". Pure water bottles in the mini-bar costs 10$ - that's crazy! When i wanted to order shuttle to the hotel, they tried to charge for the telephone call they made. 1 minute of the internet costs 1$ - the highest price I've ever seen worldwide. There's no good place to sit in the lobby. Adding to that, I can say that we had severe problems with the block in the shower room - every time I went there we got a mini-flood. Needless to say, there was no radio or TV while the Airconditioner worked in a very strange manner.

Reviews.Title: “Please avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: annie123411
Reviews.Content: Grand entrances do not reflect the tiny cell like, dark rooms with no balconies. Expensive. Do not visit the bar or cafe - take A$12 for a can of beer as a guide! Internet is $60 an hour - get real! An extra child bed was $70 a night and they could barely fit it in. The beds were also hard and thin. Try the Orchard Parade at the other end of Orchard Road - huge rooms with balconies, for a little bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: chivasd
Reviews.Content: Had a really lovely 3 night stay here. Very comfortable bedroom with flat screen tv and good air-con. Bathroom was spotlessly clean, shower was huge and had excellent pressure. Plenty of complimentary cosmetics as well. The hotel overall was perfectly clean, well maintained, very quiet, staff were friendly and very helpful and it was based in a great loaction with lots of cafes/shopping areas within a short walk. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, smart and convenient hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: benrobinson
Reviews.Content: Halfway between Orchard Rd and the Singapore river, this hotel is in a great location. Staff were all very friendly and couldn't do enough to help. Communal areas were immaculate, the bedroom was clean and very comfortable the bathroom was also great. No noise from the nearby roads or other guests. This is a short review as I have no compaints about this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “A good clean hotel in the most convenient location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Harrikris
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a real delight . The housekeeping was done every day while we were out and we returned to a well cleaned room every time .. The toiletries were also replaced to our entire satisfaction .The rooms are small but then again Singapore hotels have this problem. The Bras Basah MRT station is just outside which is part of the yellow Circle and the Doby Ghaut MRT is a 5 minute walk away. Doby Gaut MRT is a Interchange station to 3 different connecting MRT lines which can take you practically across anywhere in Singapore . There are a couple of 7-11 shops right across the hotel. And beside one there is a good money exchange shop also. Fort Canning park is a walk away and Orchard road is maybe 2 kms away. Little India is just one station away from Doby Gaut where you can get a good Indian meal. The staff of the hotel impressed us with very courteous and polite behavior also .And we would definitely stay only in this hotel when we return back to Singapore. We did not have food though from the hotel as the breakfast was priced high and we could get a meal at half the price outside . But that is nor extraordinary as other hotels in Singapore also does the same. All in all, would defintely reccomend this in view of the clean, professional service as well as the location .

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel but exchange rate made it pricey”
Reviews.Author: Bonnyblink
Reviews.Content: Hotel was situated near an underground station and surrounded by shopping malls. Raffles was a 10 minute walk away. A non-descript hotel from the outside but very comfortable inside. Room overlooking pool was very quiet- didn't even hear anyone in the corridor or in neighblouring rooms. Room was a reasonable size, air-conditioning was quiet and bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Bathroom was well stocked with smelly things and the power shower was great. If you arrive late then visit Kopitiam, a food court 50m from the hotel - leave by the exit under the staircase. It's cheap and offers good food -the Fish Soup stall and the one to the left of it were both good. The hotel computer was ridiculously expensive 1SD$ a minute but ask the consierge and he will direct you to an internet cafe where you can use the computer all afternoon for a dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: DGlobTrot
Reviews.Content: We went there during company trip, and the service was outstanding. The concierge was helpful in giving directions, the rooms were clean, bathroom was impeccable, location was great, the operator went an extra mile in giving assistance. I only had praises for this hotel! P.s: I just wish there's a clear sign of direction of the hotel, i.e bigger signboard (to make it easier to spot), etc

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Charges”
Reviews.Author: Tedpuss
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is decent enough, clean comfortable room, reasonably priced. But billing themselves as a business hotel and charging nearly $20 a day for internet is ridiculous. On top of that, because I use my laptop and ipad to log in (even though I logged in with the same user name and account) I was charged double. For this reason alone, I will not be stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but do not eat in the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: kingcheeseAustralia
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, was upgraded to a higher grade room as requested level of room was all booked out, even though room had been reserved a month in advance, but im not complaining, staff were very attentive and courteous, the only dissapionting thing about this hotel was the breakfast, a continental breakfast was $76 for two persons. whilst the selection of food was quite good, limits were placed on what you could eat, very overpriced breakfast! we ate out for the rest of our stay at some of the numerous eateries in the vicinity of the hotel, for a lot less than $76 for meals.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: OuzoandCoke
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on the strength of Trip Advisor reviews. Location is at the beginning of Orchard Rd and about 4 blocks from Bugis St markets in one direction and Raffles hotel in the other. Metro rail station is about 5 minutes walk. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the room contained a fridge, tea making facilities and an electronic safe. The pool and spa area were beautiful to say the least and staff were continually buzzing about the place cleaning and tidying up. Everyone seemed to take pride in what they were doing and this made our short stay a memorable one. We'll definitely stay there again. We did a half day city tour, visited the night zoo safari, Clark Quay and Sentosa Island where the laser light show was spectacular and would recommend all of these.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect hotel. Fantastic...”
Reviews.Author: Emily_Jane_1986
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect hotel. Fantastic location: MTR 2 mins walk away with quick access to financial quarter, raffles, orchard avenue, china town and little India plus more. All staff extremely helpful and tour operator available in hotel means easy access to all tourist attractions. The rooms are modern spacious and clean!! Didn't sample food in hotel but believed to be of high quality.

Reviews.Title: “A Rendezvous Place to Stay with perfect ambience, location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: DESI_TRAVELLER77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Rendezvous Hotel in July for 3 Nights, with my wife and 2 kids, it was a memorable stay, the Location is brilliant as everything wiz orchard road market district, little india, bugis night market etc are at walking distance, we stayed in 2 different rooms, they were not so much big but the ambience and clinliness inside rooms was excellent, also the hotel premises was so nice, clean and well administered, the breakfast was good and we found the staff to be extermly helpfull.... overall i give 9 aout of 10 points..... really awesome stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideFlower
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my Daughter and I have stayed at the Rendezvous. As per our previous visit 2 years ago the staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are comfortable and the location is great. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Poor Breakfast & Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bombproofritz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well located, between Orchard Road and Little India. It lacks good breakfast. specially for the vegetarians there was no variety at all. The rooms in the new wing are very very small otherwise cleanliness was very good

Reviews.Title: “Clean, courteous but dont eat or drink there $$$$”
Reviews.Author: VickyJMelbourne
Reviews.Content: we found the hotel to be very clean and the staff were very helpful, the pool was gorgeous with pool towels supplied. the only downfall was the price of food and drink at the hotel was way overpriced, there is a 7/11 across the rd that i frequented daily. the MRT was an easy small block walk, the express also stopped across the rd from the Hotel, the bed was a tad hard for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence_ChCh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is central and well located for access to shopping, food and galleries. We stayed there twice: en-route to the UK and again on the way back to New Zealand. The rooms were just fine for our needs (comfortable bed and very effective air conditioning) and the staff great. Breakfast was excellent and dinner pretty good although the latter was a bit expensive. Highlights? central location and the wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: IngridHongKong
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a work trip, and was very happy with the location, service and breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great place, helpful staff & lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: lovetheunexpected
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in early August and we were very impressed with the quality of the hotel for the price we paid. The rooms were very comfortable and well equipped with robes, iron & ironing board, DVD player, discreet washing line and even weighing scales. The bathroom was small but very well designed with full range of toiletries. It is in a great location close to Brash Basar MRT station and good 24hour eating establishments. The concierge helped sort out airport transfer contact, printed off our boarding passes and phoned Raffles hotel for us. We were very happy with our stay and would highly recommend the Rendezvous Hotel

Reviews.Title: “A rendezvous with Rendezvous”
Reviews.Author: tambalyn
Reviews.Content: I made my trip to Singapore on last minute decision (1 week before) and just clicked on good deals on the internet. I found this one for about 500SGD deal for 3 nights. I am familiar with Rendezvous as I mostly stay at Bayview when Im in Singapore. I wasn't expecting a good room as it was like a really cheap price but I was surprised that it's relatively good. It's not the modern ones that you see in new/newly renovated hotels but it's not bad. The bed was big and soft, our room looked out to the small pool. It wasn't LCD TV though but at least you get your news in the morning, you dno't spend the whole day in the hotel anyway. The bathroom is clean although I saw some dark spots in some corners of the shower area and on the ceiling but it's not really that bothersome. In general, it is a good hotel to base at when in Singapore. Our deal didn't include breakfast which is not an issue as across is a 24-hr Kopitiam which for me offers a more "Singaporean" food experience. For the regular kaya toast, egg and tea, you only pay 2.50SGD! There's also a 7-11 store next to the Kopitiam where you can buy your mineral water for about 2.50SGD compared to the 9SGD that they charge in the room. Rendezvous' biggest advantage would be its location --- it's at the end of the Orchard Road so it's not busy/noisy. In fact, I really love this part of Singapore. Dhoby Gaut station is only 10-min walk away while on both sides of the hotel are bus stops. One can also easily walk along Bras Basah road all the way to the Esplanade while 2 blocks down Bencoolen would be Sim Lim Square (less than 5 min walk). Little India is just 1SGD away by bus in little less than 5 mins. The earlier mentioned Kopitiam and 7-11 also make Rendezvous a very good place to stay. The hotel staff is also very helpful and very friendly. What I didn't like? well, the 9SGD tab on the mineral water. although most hotels I have stayed in Sin really don't have complimentary water. But with the 7-11 across, it's not a big fuss!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break.”
Reviews.Author: Joannalovestotravel
Reviews.Content: *Good central location, super close to Raffles, The Museum, Chijmes and Orchard Road *Excellent concierge who booked us onto the excellent Night Safari *Tasty restaurant on site

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a very central location”
Reviews.Author: Christine_sing
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room first, but once given one on the 4th floor, we upgraded a day later. In standard rooms the internet is not free and it costs a lot to get it extra. The Club rooms are from the 9th floor onwards, and internet is included, so is breakfast. Its available also in the Club Lounge, but just considering the available space, going down to the main Straits Cafe for breakfast is the option with more choices. The selection is nice with a lots of Asian and Western dishes. We liked the features in the club rooms, like iPod chargers, and wall sockets which fit all plugs, plus a walk-in shower instead of balancing over a bath tub. I would not give them full marks due to the reception we got on check-in, I do firmly not believe that the hotel was so booked out that no higher floor was available, and that the only other alternative would have been to take a suite. The ladies who do the room cleaning were exceptionally friendly (thought I lost something and had to hunt for it). The gym is nice and equipped ok, 2 working treadmills and a few steppers, the pool is a little small. You would not stay there to swim in the pool though, since all shopping malls are within walking distance - well, almost. Otherwise, there is the main circle line MRT station (Dhoby Gaut) very close.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELTHEWORLDLondon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - and very courteous staff.. Location excellent- staff very helpful in arranging trips.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Aussieflyer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in Singapore 4 times over 25 years and this time for 4 nights. We were "upgraded" to a 10th floor room. This is not a large hotel, so checking in or obtaining concierge advice is very quick and easy. The staff in every position were very friendly and efficient. The lifts are never busy or a long wait.The room was very quiet,clean. good fitout, everything you required, but average sized room with a one-person- at a- time bathroom(modern decor). This is an easy location, close to Bras Basah and Douby Ghaut Interchange underground train stops. Several food halls and bars (including The Loof rooftop bar) within walking distance. It is the "historic /university" district. If you are looking for a hotel with expansive pool area, this is NOT the place (compare Swisshotel Merchant Court, the Hyatt,)- just small, no bar, poolside service, little sun, no umbrellas) but adequate for a quick swim at end of day. This hotel is a more casual base from which you can use the MRT to get anywhere and not be living amongst the busy areas such as Clarke Quay or Orchard Rd. We would definitely return there.

Reviews.Title: “Will denfinitely stay again should need arise.”
Reviews.Author: lawtong
Reviews.Content: We just stayed the one night as a stop over before continuing our journey. Wish we had stayed longer, the service was excellent. We could not have wished for a better helpfulness from staff in the reception. The room was very nice and clean with every effort made to make the stay comfortable. Maybe the location is a tidy walk from the main shopping area, about half an hour but only ten minutes from the railway station for travel to and from the airport. Travel couriers call to pick up regularly for scenic tours which we took advantage of, would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting good service for a reasonable price. One outstanding service was although checkout was 12 noon we were able to leave our luggage until 6pm and were allowed to have a quick shower and freshen up in the pool area with towels supplied. Gordon Lawton Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in convenient position”
Reviews.Author: Salty2010
Reviews.Content: The Rendezvous was perfect for our stay in Singapore. It had everything that one would expect from a good city hotel, clean rooms, good service, helpful staff, a tour desk in the lobby, and was conveniently located, close to buses and the excellent train service. The rooms were large and comfortable with plenty of storage and all modern amenities. Being in a central location we found it simple and easy to get to basically anywhere and shuttles call at this hotel to collect and drop off anyone who's going to one of the night shows or other venues such as the night zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice amenities in room.”
Reviews.Author: daphseow
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night. We were lucky to get bumped up to the Club floor. First thing I noticed about the room was the very high, big bed (which suited hubby and I just fine cos we are tall!). The room is not very big but it has great amenities, such as large flat screen TV and all the little things that you may need such as a fridge, bath robes, hair dryer, iron, huge mirrors, etc. I especially loved the bathroom (great lighting for ladies to put on make up!) with the fancy toilet seat that warms itself up. There is also a rainfall shower head which I love. The room was clean, comfy mattress and pillows and nice toiletries. Best part is, the hotel is in a very convenient location. About 2-3 mins walk to the Dobby Ghaut MRT and just about 100m away from the Bras Basah MRT. Also there are lots of food joints downstairs, including a large food court round the corner and a 7-11 convenience store.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly concierge super helpful & saved me $$”
Reviews.Author: jimileek
Reviews.Content: I stayed @ this hotel with my sister who was in Singapore on business. She was busy all day while I got a chance to explore Singapore's charms. Every staff I encountered was friendly. The lady who cleaned our room was delightful. The concierge @ the Rendezvous Hotel were a great help & saved me $$ time & again. I wanted to visit Chinatown & Little India & Kampong Glam. Instead of dropping $20+ on a hop-on-hop-off tour bus, one concierge made it simple for me "stand here, take any bus, get off 5 stops to China town, pay $1. Or stand there, all busses except one go to Little India. 6 stops, pay $1" I wanted to buy water & juices to store in the room & the gentleman directed me to a grocery store called Cold Storage in PoMo Mall just 1.5 blocks from hotel. Save yourself time & trouble wandering around lost with a map glued to your nose. Ask these guys how to get where you're going, you'll come out ahead each time. By the way - laundry is WAAAY overpriced (they charge PER ITEM - the cheapest around $5). If your stay is extended & you don't feel like handwashing your clothes, get to PoMo Mall - in the basement is Automated Laundry where you can drop off your clothes to be laundered & dried for $13.90 or use coin-operated self-service availalbe for $5 wash & $5 dry. Kopitian is a superconvenient superclose eatery open 24 hours & frequented by locals & tourists alike. Great for coffee @ 1 AM when you don't want to risk oversleeping because your taxi is coming for you @ the unGodly hour of 3:15 AM for your 5:45 AM flight. Dhoby Gaut is nearest MRT station. Using MRT to get around is super easy - there are attendants to help you figure out the ticketing system. Plus it saves you money. Tip - bring your umbrella with you everywhere & use it even on overcast days.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good rendezvous!”
Reviews.Author: hgmoorthy
Reviews.Content: I was put up in the Rendezvous Hotel, Bras Basah Road, Singapore in June for a couple of days on business. Location is very good but sadly the service standards and room quality is average. I got bumped up to a suite on arrival but the suite was very ordinary for the standard of the hotel and the rate I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Close to India town and shopping”
Reviews.Author: luvpeopleeverywhere
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Singapore to renew my Visa for Bali, I had three days and spent it in comfort at the Hotel Rendezvous. The restaurant had a superb buffet, the bellhop very helpful with some details I required. It is close walking distance to a number of shopping areas from Little India to Mall shopping as well a short taxi ride away from the waterfront where there is an abundance of restaurants and stores to wander through. The room was well appointed and had all the amenities I required, the bedsheets and pillows were quite lovely quality and felt luxurious after being on a sandy beach for several weeks. Not far from the hotel was a lovely little tea shop, I had a lesson in tea drinking the teas were prepared by students, an excellent experience and walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon @ Rendezvous”
Reviews.Author: RuchiBallal
Reviews.Content: Singapore was the first destination for our honeymoon and also my first vacation outside of India, so there was anyways a high chance i would love it and of-course i did. The location of the hotel was really comfortable and very close to Orchard while still not in the middle of it, since i went in December it was good to NOT be at Orchard Road due to the crowds parading there. The breakfast spread was great, the muffins and hashbrowns were specially yummy, rooms were cozy and comfortable. All in all we loved the hotel and Singapore so much that we moved here shortly after and are now living and working here...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Good Meeting Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DurbanGal
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights. Clean, comfortbale, basic. Breakfast very lavish but not so great for veggies.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful and pleasant trip”
Reviews.Author: sobercece
Reviews.Content: We booked Rendezvous hotel thru asiatravel.com together with our USS trip. It was a great stayed in this hotel, its less than a minute walk to the cathay, n super near to the MRT station "Dhoby Ghaut"- it's a center part of most of the MRT transit, super convenience whereby our Singaporean friend even easy to call out "ohh... that hotel~!! easy! i take cab/ MRT come n pick u up~!!" Good Location with lots of buses around. Museum and art center as well. i didn't expect the service of the hotel was so great as i imagine, they are kind especially while we waiting for our transfer to USS. Well, they are truly friendly and you can put trust on. No harm to have a try , it's really value with the money, me and my hubby really looking forward our upcoming singapore trip to stay back this hotel =p HAVE FUN GUYS~!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Honeymoon Experience- Singapore”
Reviews.Author: KoolJosh
Reviews.Content: The First time I visited Singapore was on my Honeymoon, One could experience the freshness & cleanliness of the city the moment you get out of the Airport. We stayed at Hotel Rendezvous, near Dhobi Ghaut MRT station. Its was real value for money and the best located. Opposite hotel was 7-11 Store and mega foodcourt. All the amenities were provided by the Hotel staff we could ask for eg;- Iron with board, sp. Veg cuisine tailor made for us. To get good Indian Veg Food, we walk 150m everyday to catch MRT & visit Little India. Travelling by MRT is Inexpensive in Singapore and you could reach all the tourist spots conveniently (Except Orchid Garden & Night Safari). Even 5days are less to explore Singapore! A must visit country if you cannot travel United States because of small travel Budget. Hotel is Value for Money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: ColumbusCompass
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in the Rendezvous booked through Hotels.Com. This hotel is located near Bras Basah underground station (200 mtrs) on the yellow line and an easy 5 min walk to Dhoby Ghaut on the purple, red and yellow interconnect points. The hotel is situated in an excellent location with many attractions in easy reach including walking to them. Rendezvous to the airport is 30 mins by underground at about $1.40 for a single trip. Important note, the hotel takes a $100 security deposit when you check in. If you pay by credit card, then they swipe and tear up the receipt on departure. If you pay by debit, the take the money back then refund you upon departure. You may loose on the exchange rate so be careful. I did not want to give them cash as I did not want to get $100 back at the end of my trip so they took Australian dollars as I was stopping in Singapore en route to Oz. They took $100 AUD cash and sealed it in an envelope and it goes in a safe. I was able to check and get in my room at 11:30, if you arrive early, you can check in and leave your bags with reception and get into your room later. My room faced off the road so no view but very quiet. Room was air conditioned with a safe in the room, ironing board and iron and clothes hangers. There was a TV and mini bar; the prices are very high so be warned. The shower was in the bath, there was a good range of towels, even an extendable washing line in the bathroom. I never ate at the hotel as the prices were a bit steep so I went out for breakfast and dinner. If you hunt around, you can buy breakfast very cheap. There is a cheap breakfast and lunch place on the corner near the hotel; I would not recommend it to be honest as the quality was pretty poor. It is called Bistro xxx and located at 51 Bras Basah road. The Coffee Club do excellent eggs and smoked salmon for breakfast, accept the one in the lobby area of the hotel which does not serve breakfast. I was never too sure if you can drink the water in the hotel or not, down stairs in the court yard is a little shop that sells bottled water, 1.5 litres for $2.50. The 7/11 around the corner sells the same for $4.50. Be warned, some bottled water is distilled water and not spring water. There is a bar in the court yard of the hotel that does a happy hour from 5-8.30pm, one for one. This seems to be common in Singapore. The hotel put on Chelsea V Liverpool on a big screen in the court yard on a large projector, and to my amazement, around 100 Singaporeans wearing Liverpool shirts turned up to watch the game and have a drink. There was a mix of young and old and It was all very good natured and nice to watch. They are mad on football over there and both Liverpool and Man United are very popular, so you can guarantee that if either is playing, then the game will be showed. I would have no hesitation on going back to this hotel and it was one of my best stays in a hotel I have had in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ApuN
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with the room service. As i went with my 15 months old daughter I called up room service many time to boil milk for her. And the service they offered was really good and quick. On top of that, we reached there early in the morning and they gave us early check-in and permitted late check-out. ;) Rooms are very small but clean. We didnt have lunch/dinner in the hotel but breakfast was OK. Overall experience was nice.

Reviews.Title: “I would pick a different hotel on my next visit”
Reviews.Author: echoi
Reviews.Content: 5 of us flew out for a weekend getaway, and we picked this place because it was offered as a flight/hotel package. On the first day we all got rooms with 2 single bed, since we were 2 pair plus 1, we asked to be switch to queen size but none was available (not hotel's fault as our agent made a mistake in booking the wrong type of room). The room we got was on the lower floor, equipped with "this should be in the museum" TV and old furniture. On 2nd day, we got a room change message from the front desk when we got back to the hotel near midnight. While the other couple's new room TV did not work, our room stink of cigarette smell, we told the front desk and again she said the hotel is full. So we went to our old room and said we would deal with it in the morning. Minutes after we hang up we got a call again (it's midnight) and this time they have a room for us on the upper floor (we were told the hotel is full). So we grab our bags and got up there. It turns out that although they are listed at the same type and pricing, these rooms are recently renovated with LCD TV, modern furniture, colgate toothpaste (lower floor room's toothpaste are un-labeled). However, although the new room is newer, I still find 2 of the lights failed to work and 1 bedside light is loosely hung from the wall... My take on this thing is that although they're priced equally, they would put your in a "lesser" room if you're travelling on a package deal (colgate vs. non label, hell, the shampoo even smelled better). I mean, with a vast variety of hotels in the nearby neighborhood and are similarly priced... why should I be bothered this?! my only positive comment about this hotel is that there's a foodcourt right across the street and you won't be disappointed. But since there's another hotel right next to this hotel, I think I'll give it a shot instead on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Stay.”
Reviews.Author: PHXGAL
Reviews.Content: I am here right now on business. Got a rate that included wired internet and breakfast. If you can get those included, it is a great deal. Buffet is super and I had no problems with the internet. I swam laps this morning in the pool, there were a few others doing the same. I heard the Indian restaurant is good, just have not tried yet. TV is not great, but I'm not using much. Gym is great:lots of machines, free weights, weight machines, mats, and it's large.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Annie2250
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in the deluxe room and found the hotel to be close to transport, including the MRT, shopping and restaurants. The buffet breakfast was fabulous and offered a wide range of food which was slightly changed to add variety each morning. The staff were courteous and attentive - in particular the conciege was very helpful. One example was that we rang down to ask for ice which arrived very qucikly, and then received a call from housekeeping within minutes to check that we had received it. Of note are the comfortable beds and the cleanliness of the rooms which whilst not large were more than adequate for our needs as we didn't spend too much time in the room. You can also get the yellow hop on hop off bus from right behind the hotel which is recommended as a great orientation trip. There was just so much to see and do in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: clubsushi
Reviews.Content: My recommendation is - pay a bit more and stay at Pan Pacific. We stayed at Rendezvous on our stopover on the way to Europe and at Pan Pacific on the way back. Rendezvous was about $60 cheaper but Pan Pacific was 3 timas as good. Rendezvous looks much better on the internet - we were so dissapointed when we saw it. The room was small, dark and shabby. Not the sort of place you want to hang out and relax in - which is what we want for a stopover. It was dinghy and depressing and we felt ripped off considering it wasn't exactly cheap. I would definatley recommend spending a bit more money for something better - in the case of the Pan Pacific which was only $60 dearer - the 2 could not be compared. Rendezvous staff were alright but again - could not be compared with the wonderful staff at Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, ever”
Reviews.Author: elenjohos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (with our 3 children) stayed at Rendezvous Hotel from April 7-11, 2010. They gave us adjacent rooms. The hotel's location was perfect as it is located 100m away from Dhoby Ghaut MRT station. There were restaurants and pubs within the complex. A few metres away were shopping centres, museums, and Kopitiam. It was very accessible to Bugis Street, Bugis Junction, Chinatown and Orchard Road. A few metres away was the famous Sim Lim Electronics Center. Another reason to stay in this hotel would be the clean rooms and the great buffet breakfast in their coffee shop. The staff, though, needs to smile more often. The following are the areas for improvement: 1) They need to show their guests that they are welcome in the hotel. I noticed that the Filipino staff were the only ones with a ready smile. 2) Free wi-fi in the rooms should be provided for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location But Tired Hotel With Few Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Zelemenos
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about the hotel was its location. The hotel was tired. The rooms were in need of a complete revamp. The public areas to relax in were very limited (only two sofas). There was no atmosphere. Staff were OK but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: Staffordblonde
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after looking on Tripadvisor and was not disappointed it is in a great location, rooms were comfortable and I found the staff extremely helpful particularly when I ended up with a 5 hr delay on my flight home. The food was fine, didnt use the pool which yes from what I could see was not very big but adequate. Everyone I came in contact with was without exception polite and helpful in the extreme would definetly recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel @ Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Aexander_M-1984
Reviews.Content: We have visited Rendezvous Hotel Singapore @ 21-29 Jan 2010. It was our stopover at Singapore. I have booked standart room in advance, but as far as we had a honeymoon with my wife, Rendezvous Hotel had upgraded us to Deluxe room FREE OF CHARGE. We were very pleased. The Hotel has blocked some prepayment @ my card on arrival and returned the deposit in 2-3 days after departure. Basically, the staff was extremely polite and very helpful. We had really enjoyed our stay! Rendezvous Hotel is located close to Dhoby Ghaut MRT station (3-5 min walk), Cathay Mall (just 1-2 min walk) and Kopitiam (2-3 min walk) I would definitely recommended this hotel to all travellers, visiting Singapore. Thank you, Rendezvous, for such a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL IN A GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: MRGK
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel with centrally located with easily accessible to major shopping malls & Orchard street. Approx 10mnts walk to closeset MRT Station. Approx 10-15mnts walk to Little India Approx 5-10mnts walk to Orchard street. Rates on a bit Higher side, but very strict on the chkin time, if u arrive early at the htl htl you will have to wait either on the poolside or the lobby till 1300hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Chuck91
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 14 days in February and March 2010. I must say that I was very satisfied with the cleanliness, the service and friendliness of the staff and the location. I was on the 4th floor for a few days before moving to the 11th floor which is the Club Lounge. Breakfast at the Club Lounge is included as is Internet Connectivity. Staff was uniformly friendly and seemed quite efficient. One of the best features of the hotel is the location - there is a 7-11 and Kopitiam right across the street, Orchard Road starts around that place, and the local MRT (Dhoby Ghaut) is a short 8-10 minute walk away. Very convenient for shopping and sight seeing. The only downside I could see was that the rooms were fairly small - so if you are traveling with a family, I can imagine that you will be cramped. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayGuruUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on our return from Australia. Rooms was spacious and had one of the most comfortable beds and pillows I have ever slept on. Reception and concierge staff very helpful. Great location and wonderful for shopping. Also easy to get local transport (tube) and a stop for the SIA bus. Was here for the build up to the Chinese New Year and went to Clarke Quay were they had fireworks and the dragon dance also had a great meal overlooking the waterfront. Went to the night safari on an organised tour with the hotel; however would recommend getting a taxi there by yourself, which is what we did last time in Singapore, as you have more time to look round. One last comment, had such a laugh using the electronic bidet!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Mandy46
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at start and again at end of trip to New Zealand. Hotel is well located between the historic and commercial centre and Orchard Road. Pleasant lobby; room very adequate and well equipped; bath tub, tea and coffee. But note: the water in the room (not in the minibar) is not complementary and is charged at minibar prices! Lots of choice at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: NWIK
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and while the hotel was unable to check us in earlier due to the room occupants checking out late, they did store our luggage and offer us access to the pool level with showers and bathrooms. The concierge was knowledgable and helpful, and the rooms, while not the largest, were clean and good value for money. There was only room to store one suitcase conveniently, and the hairdryer was somewhat lacking but these are minor details. The location is central with easy access to shopping and the MRT. The only criticism would be that parking is not included for guests, which again was only a minor irritant.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: cachecacher
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights on corporate rate. booked a queen but was given 2 twin beds instead. staff made little effort to apologize or find alternative queen room for me. upgraded for free to plaza room but without amenities. eg. requested for free shoe shine service but was rudely refused because "the plaza room was an upgrade with no other service". i found the staff to be no more friendly and helpful than those found in your average hotel, yet this one is more pricey than most in singapore. room was great though not spacious (and mind you, this is already a plaza room. if you want space, go for a suite). comfortable and clean. plaza room comes with ipod dock, your usual lcd tv with many channels (watched australian open here!). shower was okay, but no tub (apparently, you have to downgrade to a "deluxe" room to get a tub). bed was comfy but again, i got twin, not queen as asked for. room can get cold and the thermostat is useless in that respect. had to turn it off several times to get the temperature i desired. btw, wired internet is not free. its $20+ per day! remember to get the internet cable from the concierge when you check in. parking is not free either but i think hotel guests can get day parking for a reduced rate. didn't use the gym nor pool facilities, so i cannot comment on that. there's a restaurant and a bar, and both were decent but pricey. in this part of town, there are lots of options for food and shopping. this is what i really liked about the hotel -- location. the subway is a 5 mins walk away and the shopping district -- orchard road -- too. you can also get to the more commercial part of town -- city hall -- in 15 mins by foot. overall, i think the hotel just needs to employ better staff and it would be pretty good. i would stay here again on corporate rate, but not on standard rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mikeg113
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Rendezvous at the end of our honeymoon. From the moment we arrived the staff were friendly and courteous. We arrived early morning and were given an early check in. We were able to get a room upgrade to a deluxe room which probably helped our view of the hotel. However, all areas seemed extremely clean and spacious. The pool area is also great – and the gym is not bad. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is at the base of Orchard street (about a 10 minute walk to the shopping area and 25 minutes to the centre of the street) and a 5-10 minute walk to Raffles hotel. It is also close to the train station – which is clean and easy to use. Overall we had a very pleasant stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: ccci
Reviews.Content: We encountered the most unfriendly front desk staff ever! We requested for queen size bed but was told there was none. ONly when we said that we are cancelling our stay that they 'found' a room for us. Further, the hotel is old and rather unconfortable. Definitely not going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Needs an Upgrade and Better Housekeeping- Qualified Recommendation Only”
Reviews.Author: aavery
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 nights in total - 5 nights, then 3 out of town, and then 5 nights more. Traveled with my husband who was on business with the university across the street, hence the reason we stayed here. Hotels are surprisingly expensive in Singapore, so I would have to say the rates here were reasonable. However, you do get what you pay for, as you will read below. Hotel is in best location one could wish for as a tourist, can walk to all museums, Chinatown, Little India, Arab Street, etc. A quick, inexpensive bus ride to the incomparable Botanical Gardens, close to Orchard Road and Raffles Hotel, etc. Would have rated this hotel more highly but for the indifferent housekeeping in the rooms (clearly our carpet was hardly vaccumed as both stays I found rubber bands or price tags on the floors which weren't mine!) and the shabby hallways with a funny smell coming out of the elevator, tattered/stained carpet and worn/dirty white sofa. At least the carpet in our 6th floor room had been replaced and for the most part the room was fine, if a bit dated. Ask for a room facing the street as the windows are double paned so they aren't too noisy and there is more light and a view if you are higher than the 5th floor. Air con worked well, thank goodness, given the hot humid weather. Our first 5 nights we were upgraded to an executive floor which was significantly nicer, recently upgraded. However, the surcharge is normally $30/$50 Singapore for single/double to get the upgrade to these floors. Normal room price only included breakfast for one, and the buffet is way too expensive for breakfast, so hop down the street to the French bakery/deli on the next block. Staff very polite, quick/efficient check in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mky337
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by this hotel, it's in a great location for walking around Singapore and great value. We stayed on a recently refurbished floor, i think it was the 9th.. which was really nice, great shower/bathroom, very comfy beds. Would definately return and recommend to anyone wanting a good value, good location hotel in what can be a pretty expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service, non smoking”
Reviews.Author: combebelle
Reviews.Content: Reasonable size clean modern room with shower, hotel restaurant fresh, light, and cheerful. Close to Raffles, Orchard road and Little India. Near historic district so shophouses and cafes abound and nicer environment than main business centre. outdoor pool. no negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed in Singapore !”
Reviews.Author: Durhamguy
Reviews.Content: This was my third time in Singapore and its always a difficult place to choose a hotel for given the wide choices available. The Rendezvous I found to be an excellent choice though not everyone on TripAdvisor seems to agree judging by past reviews. The staff I found to be excellent very friendly, proffessional and helpful right from the time of checking in we were made to feel welcome. I found the hotel to be clean and comfortable though I would have prefered my room to have been hoovered more often. We had a superior room the bed was very comfy, well decorated the bathroom was ok but nothing special. Ate only once in the restaurant the Straits Cafe, nice food though menu not too inspiring, never had breakfast here. Location on Bras Basah Road don't know what people have been complaining about Dhoby Gaut MRT station is only 5 minutes walk away. Raffles Hotel and the Raffles Plaza Shopping City about 10 minutes, easy and pleasant walk to Clarke Quay and Boat Quay for Orchard Road a short ride on the MRT. Only complaint we had to make was the noise on a Saturday night, we were on the third floor and there was a wedding reception in the ballroom below other wise no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Terrible everything else.”
Reviews.Author: jaejaez
Reviews.Content: I hereby crown the newly elected 'worst hotel' of the ones I have ever set foot in. Mind you, I do not go on "bashing" hotels without justifications. I am a seasoned traveller with only moderate expectations (check my other reviews). Take it or leave it, but my advice to anyone reading this is to stay well away from this hotel for your own health and safety. I was excited to have booked a hotel close to Orchard Rd, the center of the universe in Singapore. But this excitement came crashing down right from the start at the check-in desk. Check in: Perhaps one of the most un-friendliest check-in staff I had ever interacted with. No smiles, no greetings, no welcomes. She asks for IDs, hands you the keys, tells you the check out time and expects you to 'leave'. Asked which way the elevator was and she pointed to another direction without even looking up. Where does she think this is, her own mansion?? Room: Sure, I got the standard room so was not expecting much but seeing a tube TV set looking like it was stolen from an antique shop was just too much. The toilet didn't flush properly. The basin didn't drain properly. The bed was rock hard - I have had better beds at youth hostels in Thailand. Pillows were too high. And to top it all off, my room was not made up when I came back at 11 PM. I was furious to see a messy room so called the operator to have someone make up the room immediately. Some thirty mins later two men came up, asking me "what the problem was"??? I told them that the room was not made and then they started cleaning it then, whilst I was in the room, dusting pillows, wiping the basin etc without a word of apology, all the while talking loudly themselves whilst cleaning up. How an earth am I supposed to rest???? (remember, this was at around 11:30 PM). So I went out into the streets at MIDNIGHT, walked over to the nearby 7-11 to get myself a bottle or orange juice, hung around alone for a while and then returned to my room to realize that yes, it was cleaned up but the sheets were not new, neither were the towels or the pillows. They were 'tidied up' but were still dirty (coffee stain from the morning was still there). Enough said about the room. Breakfast: Quite good, no complaints. Pool: Quite good. Morning disaster: Pls let me know if you ever had this happen to you at a so-called "3+ star property". I was sound asleep in the morning at around 10:30 AM on the day of my checkout when the doorbell rang. I ignored it and kept on sleeping… but then the person decided to WALK INTO MY ROOM. And yes, I was not wearing anything. The person came into ask whether I had any laundry????? Still half a sleep, I uttered 'no…..' to which the staff went away. After about 15 minutes, I had another doorbell ring, and to my absolute resentment, this person walked into my room as well. I woke up from my bed and heard this man ask me whether I had any minibar consumption???????? After this I woke up, got showered and dressed fully to storm downstairs to complain. Not only the worst experience at a hotel but one that is humiliating and atrocious. Do they know the first thing on privacy??? Not only will I NEVER return to this property, I am going to do mankind a favor by telling all my fellow travellers to stay away from this place. Lousy service, no apologies, arrogant staff and people that do not respect your privacy… running this junk as a 'business' is a crime.

Reviews.Title: “Close to train...comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: nammiesgal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated just outside the hustle and bustle of Orchard Road. If you are a traveller looking for a quieter hotel, then this is the one for you. It is conveniently located near Dolby Ghout station so a quick train ride can get you to Orchard Road or Raffles City within no time. The rooms were very clean and the staff helpful. All in all, a very comfortable stay. Pros: Short 5 min walk to Dolby Ghout station. Staff helpful especially on our last day in Singapore when our arranged cab driver nearly didn't turn up. Staff kindly assisted us in locating our cabbie. Also arranged for our wakeup call on the morning we were leaving. Very clean and tidy rooms. Comfortable stay. Cons: Beds are a little hard. Need time to get used to. Bath tub plug didn't drain water quick enough during shower. Water started building up quickly. Room we were staying in was on the small side. It didn't worry us as we only used the rooms for sleeping and spent most of the days exploring Singapore. Decore a little outdated but still in good nick. Location not very central as it is between Orchard Road and Raffles City. Lucky there is a nearby train station!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjbsteven
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. Good value hotel, clean with good service. The room was well appointed, comfortable and a good size. We got a special room rate when asked for. The location is great and there is a nice pool at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “will not return to this one”
Reviews.Author: pekkachiu
Reviews.Content: i swear i will not return to this hotel!!! it's very far from Orchard Road (the actual shopping place) you have to take a taxi to places or you just sweat urself with a 10-15 mins walk to the MRT station. we stayed there for 8 nights, they hardly replace our amenities (meaning cotton buds, toilet paper & even laundry bag). their staff was not friendly at all on the fone. moreover, in one of the days, their housekeeping just left a dirty wet cloth on top of our table.... this hotel feels really dirty. their standard rooms look like one of those from ancient times.... with this price, i can stay at traders and have free breakfast for 2!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay at the Rendezvous Singapore”
Reviews.Author: catamber
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. The staff were friendly, helpful and accommodating. We were upgraded us to a superior room which was compact but very clean and stylish. Our two bookings were combined into one so we didn't have to change rooms in the middle of our stay. Able to have a shower before designated check in time which was fantastic after a red eye flight. Location was great - just off Orchard Rd and close to shops and transport. They also have 1/2 price drinks in the afternoon at the bar downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect match! Anytime again! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: wolfman64
Reviews.Content: Rendezvous is the best choice in Singapore - close to Orchard (for shoppers), close to Boat Quay (walking distance). The room was very neat, clean and very nice. its exactly the hotel I like to stay in, when I need to be in the heart of it. It was silent - no noise. Staff was very helpful. The best. in the restaurant I had the best Laksa ever.......Also for my leisure trip i would take this hotel, because of its location, but also because of its people!

Reviews.Title: “Great price! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: imsuchafuss
Reviews.Content: Room - up to date. bathroom are of a good size and so is room and beds are comfy. Pool - is small but very nice. Location - still in the strip of Orchard Road so everything is walking distance. Well worth e price as you can walk back to hotel from shopping or from clubbing. Food - did not try anything as its much cheaper getting breakfast from across the road and plenty of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Ok for a short visit”
Reviews.Author: CRobo
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, situated at the beginning of Orchard road and within 5 minutes walk of the nearest metro station. Originally planned on staying in the standard room, but upgraded to the executive room, which has just undergone refurbishment. Room was nicely decorated, clean and comfortable and had wireless internet access. Hotel offered a happy hour between 6-8pm, but drinks did not include Singapore Sling, which was a shame. All in all, a pleasant stay,

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, just boring!”
Reviews.Author: iamozbok
Reviews.Content: It's a good hotel for the basics of travel - location, pool etc but it just seemed boring! The pool is great but the TV channels aren't a good selection for English speaking travellers (other hotels have far wider variety). When we checked in the room had not been made up as the housekeeping was busy socialising with another housekeeper up the corridor. She didn't even realise we had entered the room and later entered without knocking. The concierge is not the brightest and not very well informed about his city. But like I said it's good location - right up from Orchard Rd without the Orchard Rd hotel prices. If you go to their website and click their special on the scroll down on the prices page, you can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Rendezvous in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: red_feather25
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Rendezvous Hotel. The hotel staffs are accommodating to our concerns although we are early for the designated check in. We availed the superior room of the hotel and it really exceeds our expectation. But you must bring some toiletries like toothbrush & toothpaste since they don’t include that for the superior room accommodation. There are stores like 7-11 or Watson’s store near the hotel to buy your toiletries and other personal needs. There are a lot of nice food courts around the vicinity of the hotel. The hotel is accessible to MRT, bus stops, malls and other places of interest. But watch out for the security deposit they charge on your credit card, we were not advise ahead of time that there was a such but it was returned a week after our trip. But overall, I appreciate the hotel and I would definitely recommend Rendezvous hotel to my friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: giogio42
Reviews.Content: I have been in this hotel several times as my company use it as corporate hotel in Singapore. Last time I have arrived late and even if my reservation was confirmed and payed in advance, they told me that my room was not available. They offered me to stay one night in what they call " a much smaller room ". I checked the room they offered and it was so small that I had to call the reception and asked to discuss this issue with the manage on duty. I explained that when they sold a reservered room, they should upgrade you to a better room not to a room with a size of a bathroom!!. When they realized that my company used they hotel several days per month, they immeditely relocate me to a bigger room....not very professional! In general, the rooms are OK but nothing special. The breakfast, again, is OK but,again, nothing special. You can find a better hotel ( at the same price) in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Relatively good hotel in the center of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: BusinessxTraveller
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with all the facilities you need for a business trip. It's a non-smoking hotel, which is good. Room felt a bit small. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: lynettelovesholidays
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights not a bad hotel but nobody really cared if we stayed there or not staff not very friendly but the hotel was ok. Its located pretty central. It had a nice pool but very enclosed. Singapore is very expensive but did visit raffles for a singapore sling its a lovely place all in all singapore has plenty of history mixed with the new 3 days was enough for me couldnt afford any more time there.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant 3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: laura25
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel in one of the Plaza Club rooms. The service provided by the staff was excellent right from the personal welcome when we arrived up to the goodbyes on departure.Had 1 breakfast in the main dining room but preferred the lovely quiet breakfast in the club lounge. Also appreciated the cocktail hours!! Our room was really nice and quiet with views of the pool. The staff were aware we were celebrating our anniversary and sent a bottle of wine to our room. Very nice touch!! Two of the staff in particular made us feel very welcome Stephanie Hoo and Shanti. The Hotel is well positioned near the MRT, Orchard Road and ofcourse Raffles. Would definately return and have no hesitation recommending this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tarty
Reviews.Content: just come back from singapore hotel was a great place to stay we arrive at 6.00am we booked a superior room we were asked if we wanted to upgrade this was the best thing we did it is alot cheaper to upgrade at the hotel than booking on line this meant we could go to our deluxe room right away also we could have breakfast and had use of the plaza club which was fantastic would reccomend this hotel great location so much too see and short walk to clarke quay marine bay orchard road also we went to santosa island great trip temp 33 day and night bliss wish the wine was as cheap as the uk but still you cant have it all book now have a great time

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: bklyn_girl
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a convenient area between end of Orchard Rd and Marina area. We were able to walk to Chijmes and Raffles (easily) and Boat Quay (pleasant stroll). Everywhere else we took taxis even though the MRT was nearby as well. We traveled with our 1 1/2 year old daughter and had nothing to worry about. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was very clean, cool and the entire hotel is smoke free. Got a great deal booking thru hotels.com and we were even upgraded to deluxe room as our cheaper room reservation ended up being full. 7-11 and local food eatery across the street. Downside for some - we could hear the water running from the showers of other rooms, but it wasn't enough to disturb or wake me.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Adelmelb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Rendezvous in Singapore in July 08, with another couple and had a great time. We had booked with Singapore Airlines as part of their stopover package and initially had another hotel booked, but had to change our dates and this was the hotel that was available for us. It was a great hotel for a stopover, but probably wouldnt have booked for a longer period of time as really is just a standard hotel with not terribly much else to offer. The rooms were nice, although we were given two rooms with single beds in rather than two rooms with king beds, seeing it was two couples travelling. Our room had a view over the street and would have been great if we could have opened the windows, but they were sealed tightly. Our friends had a great view overlooking the swimming pool. The pool area was great, we would go down after we had been out for dinner and sit in the spa and usually we had the whole area to ourselves. During the day we went for a swim, lovely pool, but does get quite busy with families. Also once the sun goes over the pool tends to get a bit cool. The hotel is located really well for shopping on Orchard Road. We would go wandering up there at night through the shops and also for some dinner and found a couple great restaurants along there. We didnt eat at the hotel at all as the buffet breakfast seemed quite pricey, however we did sit in the bar and have a cocktail which was an expensive evening. My husband and his mate had a bourbon and coke, my friend had some sort of cocktail, and I had a Singapore Sling which was more than double the price of any of the other drinks which were already quite expensive. That was the last time we drank there! Overall it was a good experience, nothing to really complain about, but also nothing to rave about. Just a standard hotel which met our needs. Would recommend the hotel to others, but as a stopover, I wouldnt be booking a trip to Singapore to stay solely at this hotel. But for a stopover is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an overnight stopover”
Reviews.Author: cheriekingsley
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight for a last minute stopover in Singapore. We stayed in the Club room and were more than satisfied with the location of the hotel. About 10mins walk to Orchard Road for shopping. Hotel has great gym facilities and a lovely pool to jump into after a workout. The room had been recently refurbished and the bathrooms exuded elegance. Only downfall is the bed - mattress is quite hard and no selection of pillows were offered. Overall a wonderful hotel with great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: hrcalso
Reviews.Content: I am seeing the world thru Hard Rock Cafe locations. This hotel was very clean, large size rooms, The breakfast was very good. They even noticed that it was my birthday. service was good. The only thing for me , I thought it was very overpriced, but maybe for Singapore it was regular.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel try to charge extras...”
Reviews.Author: zohar4
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 7:00 after long fly. The front desk manager explain to me that they are fully booked but if I will pay extra night he will give me the room. I am coming to Singapore every few months for business and its never happened to me in the past with any 4-5 star hotel. The night manager send us to wait at the pool that look like refugees camp with all the guest that waiting to their rooms. The front desk didnt tried to call us from the pool when they had free and clean rooms. Totally horrible... will not stay at this hotel anymore.

Reviews.Title: “problems if u check in late”
Reviews.Author: adventureperth
Reviews.Content: we were broke our trip to singapore by going to KL for few days coming back to same hotel. Initially we got there early and having booked and paid for three rooms, did not know what to expect. They were quite friendly and gave us a room to leave our luggage till other rooms become available which was great. However nicities finished when we left singapore and came back to check in again at 6.00 p.m. no rooms were available and after mocking around for 45 minutes the girl at the counter asked if we wanted all three rooms at the same level. We had requested non smoking double beds, that particular room was reeking of smoke and twin share!! finally changed the room, the second room did not even had a soap dish and next morning my sister woke up to sink full of ants!!!! When I asked house keeping that why at the bathroom not even a pack of cotton buds are provided, she said they don't put it for level 5 !!! They did not even put new toilet rolls for the third room, and the interesting thing is when u call the reception, they don't do anything about it either!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jimboaussie
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the hotel twice and intend to stay there again on the next trip to Singapore. The staff go out of their way to please during stay and also allow you to use facilities and look after your luggage between check out and flight departure time. Is in a central location and close to all transport. Good restaurant within the hotel. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value”
Reviews.Author: m'n'BC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week whilst working in Singapore. The hotel is well located for the MRT interchange at Dhoby Ghaut. The Cathay Cinemaplex and shopping / eating is nearby, as is the Atrium mall. It's very easy to get to the main tourist areas of Orchard Road from here as you are at the foot of Orchard Road anyway, so you could walk it (prob. 20-30 mins) or more likely, get a bus / MRT train / taxi to Orchard! Raffles Hotel is just down Bras Basah Road, as is CHIJMES for eating and drinking. Anyway, back to the hotel.... It was clean, well maintained and seemed to be busy. There were several people I spoke to who were there as a stopover en-route from Australia / NZ to Europe or the UK and so had received a free or discounted stopover in Singapore as part of their trip. All seemed happy with the hotel. The room I had didn't have a view as such but was large enough and more importantly, was clean and comfortable. The facilities on offer were what you would expect from a large hotel catering for business and tourist traffic and the front desk was efficiently run and helpful. The only complaint I had was that the WiFi in my room wasn't working, but this was minor as I had no plans on using it! The breakfast buffet was very good with a large choice of cuisines (Western / Chinese / Malay/Singaporean and Japanese) all of which were very good. The prices are OK for a hotel but as always, I would recommend getting a good B&B rate rather than pay separately. I didn't eat in the hotel in the evenings as there are so many places to try in Singapore so I can't comment about the evening offerings. There is a food court (Kopitam) across the road which is worth a shot - if for nothing else, for cheap large bottles of Tiger beer (SG$5)! The bar in the hotel is quite expensive but does a 2-for-1 happy hour. All in all, I'd recommend it as a good, comfortable base for a stay in Singapore. There's plenty to see and do so it would be a pity to spend all your time indoors once you're there, but if you had to, there are far far worse places you could be cooped up in!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: DivingPhool
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rendezvous over the Thaipusam 3-day weekend. We picked the hotel because of its central location and because it was on the lower-priced side (US$78/night). The hotel is directly on the Thaipusam pilgrimage route, making it very convenient for viewing. The hotel was very pleasant. The lobby was large, new, and clean, giving the impression of a more up-scale hotel. Staff was business-like, efficiently doing their job. The room was large enough (approximately 13 m2), containing a UK king bed (US queen), a small work desk and a chair & table, without feeling cramped. The bed was a bit hard, but not outrageously so. The bathroom was modern and well-lighted, with a good-sized tub/shower. We had no problem with noise. One oddity: the room was not square, but instead had a bit of a pie-shape to it. The room had the feel of having been recently renovated. The pool looked nice, but as we didn't use it I cannot comment on temperature or chlorine content. We did not eat any meal at the hotel, so I cannot comment on the hotel restaurants. The bar was nice but a bit pricey. A Singapore sling costs S$25, but guests of the hotel can get 2 for the price of 1. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for intruders in the middle of the night”
Reviews.Author: jimPerth
Reviews.Content: After travelling in Europe for 8 weeks we decided to spend the last three days of our holidays in Singapore before returning home to Perth. Without exception all the hotels we stayed in Europe were excellent. The first night in the Rendezvous Hotel we were woken up at 1.00 in the morning by an intruder breaking into my room. When I made a complaint to the hotel about the intruder I got no apology or explanation. The next day there were insufficient towels. The service was also terrible. When we were in the pool area we ordered two glasses of icy cold orange juice (as indicated on their menu). We had to wait half an hour before we got two small glasses of luke warm orange juice (cost $20) This is the only hotel in my 8 weeks of travelling where I did not feel safe. The service was terrible and the staff was unfriendly. However Singapore is a great city and we especially enjoyed the shopping in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: pea6uk
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Singapore at 3am and although we had booked a room from the following night in error, they gave us a room within a couple of hours so we could get some sleep! Fantastic staff, very friendly. Overall a nice, comfortable hotel - suitable for business people or those seeking a 'nice' hotel, nothing exceptional but nothing to complain about either - clean and tidy, wouldn't really recommend for families with small children. Great location with a 5 min walk to the nearest train station, 10 minutes walk to the main shopping area. Pool is very clean although the courtyard it is located in gets very little sun. We only had breakfast at the hotel, but it was fresh (replenished often), buffet style and there were sufficient choices. Would definitely stay at the Rendevous again.

Reviews.Title: “I need to forget this place!!”
Reviews.Author: Rich1974
Reviews.Content: Our Honeymoon had been going so well! We had been staying at some excellent hotels.........then we stayed at this hotel! From the time we walk in we hit probelm after problem. Where to start??? 1: The room was not ready when we arrived and we had to wait 15 minutes while they looked for something for us. This was at 3.30pm and the guaranteed check in time was 2pm!........No apology for the wait! 2: We were informed the Club rooms were under some rennovations. This was ok but they put our room directly under the drilling. We were very tired from our early morning flight and could not rest. We were told the works would stop at 5pm. At 6.30pm i had to ask the Duty Manager to get them to stop the works........he thought they had gone home already!!......no apology for the disturbance! 3: The in room internet did not work. We were told that sometime it does not work??? When we wnet downstairs to use their internet desk we were told we would need to pay $1.00 a minute! 24 hours of in room internet would have cost us $24.00!! We asked where the closest internet cafe because $1.00 a minute was the most i had ever experienced and were told it was just down the street. After much hunting around we were told by a few locals that there was no internet cafe so we walk for 10 minutes further and found one for only 8 cents a minute!
