Lucky we used our own initiative!.......no apology for the internet not working! 4: After speaking to the Guest Services Manager about the noise in our room we were offered a room move. We wanted to check it our first and found they tried to give us a downgrade! Not good! We decided to check out the following day as things were getting worse and worse..........The Guest Services Manager apologised numberous times (she was a great help by the way but to little to late) 5: I had booked the room direct with the hotel. They stated that because it was my honeymoon i would get a fruit basket on arrival. This was not there and i alerted front desk who said his colleagues would take it up while we were out. I wonder where it went because it sure was not in the room! I informed the same staff member it did not turn up and he just shrugged his shoulders..........no apology for it not arriving! Over all i really need to forget this place exhists! Honeymoons have to be memorable and this place was memorable but all for the bad reasons. Unfortunately we wasted oe whole day in Singapore due to this hotel We will not be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location away from Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: Malingshu
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Rendezvous four times and keep coming back because of the relatively good price and great location. I can't stand the hustle and bustle of Orchard Road and love the quiet surrounds of Bras Basah with its Museums, Galleries and Library. It's a short walk to the MRT, Clarke Quay and Fort Canning. The service isn't great - something inevitably goes wrong - twin went I want double (or vice versa), forget to deliver newspaper, non-smoking room with the faint smell of smoke. But it's often the best on price and for that I can overlook these issues - you have to have some patience to stay at the Rendezvous.

Reviews.Title: “My second Home”
Reviews.Author: Addy21
Reviews.Content: Rendezvous was almost my second home from 2001-2004, during which time I visited Singapore almost every second month, and always stayed at this hotel. Excellent location, great service, and used to be a great view too (the garden view rooms were a great catch, but I believe there has been some construction there recently). The rooms are average sized, clean and the service is usually pretty prompt . The fact that its very close to the orchard road is an added bonus. The staff is very friendly and usually are able to help with most of the stuff. The food is quite nice - buffet is good, however in-dining room service menu is a little limited, expecially round the clck orders. Its not very heavy on the pocket too! Great place to stay on a sight-seeing break, as the place is pretty central, well connected, and generally cheerful! I wouldnt mind going back there!

Reviews.Title: “Just superb”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeVisitor
Reviews.Content: The Rendezvous is just about the perfect property in Singapore. This is the fourth time my family and I have stayed here, and the property is always clean, the staff welcoming, and the standards of service second to none. We have also stayed at The York (terrible) and the Westin Stamford (excellent, but pricey), so the Rendezvous stacks up well on all counts. Just the perfect location and everything done right. Couldn't be better, and that's why we will always return to the Rendezvous.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for it when you go...”
Reviews.Author: SaurusAuckland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rendezvous for two nights as part of a tour package and were well pleased with the hotel which was very reasonably priced. Check-in staff were polite, friendly and efficient. Our room was large, clean, well appointed and quiet and had a pleasant garden view. Hotel is a centrally located to most attractions and the consierge was very helpful with bus schedules, possible taxi trip costs and directions. We had one breakfast there which was good and enjoyed 'High Tea' in the Palong one afternoon. The swimming pool is big enough for a decent swim and I had a few. We would stay there again and will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to everything”
Reviews.Author: lgvicki
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for three which turned out to be two single beds and a trundle bed. The trundle bed was still quite comfortable. Our room was quiet and looked out over the pool. The room was quite dated and small but clean and comforable. Had some trouble with the shower as it had only one tap for the bath and shower and you had to hold a button in to use the shower but once we worked it out the shower was great - lots of pressure and hot water. Did not eat in the hotel restaurant. We ate at the Turkish cafe, Coffee Club which are in the gourmet gallery in the hotel courtyard. we also had breakfast at Kopitam which is just up the road. Dhoby Gout MRT is about a 3 min walk. We found the motel to be very central.It was clean and we found the staff to be friendly and courteous. WOuld definitely stay here again as it was just so conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Central”
Reviews.Author: BeautifulMind000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located. The MTR is about a 5 minute walk away. Couple of good shopping malls are close by. If one is willing to walk, Raffles, Little India, Sim Lim Square (6 floors of electronics and computer equipment) is within 10-20 minutes of walking. Hotel itself is nice. The pool area is excellent .... great for a dip in the afternoon. Room itself was clean, maybe slightly dated (but maybe thats the decor) and was of a decent size. We found the buffet breakfast option extensive, but the food appeared to be cold (we stayed for 3 nights) and the quality/taste not that great.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel gave me a birthday cake!”
Reviews.Author: MissDSydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, when the sun goes down you can have a pleasant walk to chimes, Bugis or orchard rd, otherwise catch the MRT which is just across the steet, there are lots of cheap eats next door also. We stayed in a deluxe room and even though the rooms are slightly dated they are clean and staff are friendly, it was my birthday while we stayed there and the management sent me up a birthday cake, I thought that was a really nice touch. Breakfast was pretty good but a they could improve! I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at reasonable rate, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: paopao2
Reviews.Content: We have chosen this hotel because of the very good location (walking distance to Chijmes - lovely restaurants! - Little India, Arab Street, Bugis Village, Raffles City, Boat and Clake Quay, Orchard Road and, a little further, Chinatown) and because of the reasonable rate compared to other hotels of the same level in this area). It is not a luxury hotel, but do consider the rate! The standard room we had was not very large but was ok, clean, with comfortable beds and although it was on a lower floor it was quiet as it overlooked the swimming-pool. We had no time to use any service of the hotel (swimming pool, gym room, internet, etc,). Breakfast is too expensive, but some coffee shops are available along Bras Basah Road. (No complimentary mineral water in the room)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Breakfast, Rooms & Facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel012
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 5.00am for an 8 night stay to find the rooms requested (adjoining rooms) not available. Reception juggled things around to meet our request with a smile & no problem. The King size bed was a comfort and the room very clean and big enough for sleeping purposes. The tv is a little outdated but had inhouse movies & enough chanels.The bathroom was clean and I enjoyed taking a bath in peace. The concierge was always helpful as were the front desk. We were greeted every time we returned from our journeys (and there were many), with a smile and playful banter. Our room was cleaned daily. The location of the Rendevous is unbeatable. We could walk to most places we needed to go and Starbucks was only a few meters away. (Thank GOD!). The MRT was within walking distance as were bus stops. A taxi was always available at the front. We used the pool facilities as often as we could and waiter staff were always available to ask if we wanted anything. Clean pool towels were plentiful and the lounges comfortable. The full breakfast (included in our room charge) was fantastic. You could close anything from traditional singapore meals to fuit, pasties, bacon,eggs,baked beans,cereals,french toast and individually ordered omlettes. Not to forget the juices and tea & coffee. The money changer and small shop attached offered an alternative to the seven eleven accross the road. The Kapitiam (traditional foodcourt) acroos the road was welcomed after a hard day of shopping and sightseeing. The in room internet was useless and the hotel staff gladly refunded the charge. The lobby private room offering internet service was very expensive but charges are the same with all hotels. We used room service daily to order milk (olny powdered with tea & coffee facilities), ice and even bathroom scales to weigh our luggage. Service was always delivered with a smile. We never tipped anyone at the Rendevous for any service and they didn't expect it or treat us any differently. We will definately return to the Hotel Rendevous for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not even one star quality for 350 S$”
Reviews.Author: ticketmuc
Reviews.Content: This is the complaint about my stay at Hotel Rendezvous which I has sent to the Singapore Tourism Board. Dear ladies and sirs, this is a complaint on the 4 star Hotel Rendezvous in 9 Bras Basah Road. I am not sure who is assigning the stars in Singapore, but may be the Singepore tourism board could forward this to the correct receipient: I have stayed several time already at this hotel and was quite pleased with the service and quality, but with my last stay the following happened: 1) When booking they told me that the deluxe and superior rooms where all booked, so I took the most expensive room category (Plaza Club) for a room rate of 300/350 S$ which is about 50 percent more as the regular rate. The higher rate seemed ok because the have some more amenities...up to now, nothing to complain. 2) What I have received was a room that had not even one star quality. The hotel used to have a smoking floor in the 11th floor. This room has been used by smokers for several years without renovation. In January this year, they had turned the hotel in a non-smoking hotel. So, the room which I have got, was a "non-smoking room" which actually was a "smoking" room for several years - without any renovation! They had burn marks from cigarettes all over the floor and the smell of smoke and air refreshener was disgusting. When using the hair dryer, you fellt like 10 smokers blowing smoke into your face. I also made pictures of the burn marks - in case you want to see them. So, the bottom line is: This was the room with the highest rate I have ever paid in my whole life for a hotel or motel but also had the poorest quality I have ever seen in my whole life (and I have seen a lot of cheap motels already which always were better than this room) I requested to change the room and once they had availability the moved me to a different room which was really a non-smoking room. My request that they will at least charge the regular rate for that stay in this "smoking" room was rejected. I do of course not complain about the staff which was very friendly, but the STB should not allow that hotels are selling such rooms for 350 S$ as a 4* room. The room I was staying in was 1135 and everybody should feel free to check the quality of the room there - nobody would understand why this hotel has been assigned 4 stars. They have already started renovating the 11floor last monday (which shows that there was really a need for that - but of course, this doesnt help me because I had to stay in a room without any renovation for sevaral years) Best regards, Markus Sehr

Reviews.Title: “OK for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: FreqFly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overpriced for the standard of the rooms, the service is just OK but its best feature is the location. It is very close to Dhoby Ghaut MRT station and not too far from City Hall ( a major interchange station). Standard Rooms are small but clean and adequately equipped. Hotel has a pool and most other facilties.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Doha
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a very pleasurable 2 night stay at the Hotel Rendezvous. All the staff very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. The location was perfect, between Orchard Road and the Raffles / Marina area. I would have no hesitation in returning for my next visit to SIngapore.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth considering”
Reviews.Author: Cudrefin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights at the beginning of February 2008. Having been to Singapore a few times I picked this hotel based on its location, price and the reviews previously posted on Tripadvisor. Location: I wanted to be within walking distance of Chinatown, Little India, Orchard Road and Clark Quay and this hotel fitted the bill perfectly. There is not a huge amount in the way of bars and restaurants within the immediate vicinity of the hotel but a 5-minute walk would get you onto Orchard Road or well on your way to Raffles City. There was a bar (called the Public House I think) and a couple of cafes as well as a small shop within the ground floor area of the hotel. I particularly like the bar (I frequented it every night for at least 1 drink) which was open until anytime between midnight and 3:00am depending on the day of the week. Check-in: I had requested an early check-in as I arrived in Singapore at 6:00am after a 13 hour flight. Although the room wasn't ready when I arrived at the hotel at 7:00 am they did get the room ready by 10:00am which I thought was pretty good going considering that the normal check-in time is 2:00pm. The room: The room on the 6th floor and was of a good standard for the price being well maintained and very clean. The bed was huge (super king or larger) and there was good sized LCD television set into the wall. The bathroom was a decent size and also very clean. There were tea making facilities, a minibar and a safe so pretty much everything I needed. Hotel Services: I dodn't really make much use of the services as I was out and about most of the time. The hotel bar, restaurant and swimming pool looked fine although I didn't use any of them. The reception desk staff were very polite and efficient and both check-in and check-out were nice and easy. Special credit goes to the housekeeping staff who kept my room perfectly clean and tidy and who were always really friendly. Value: Not bad for Singapore. Prices have definitely risen in the last couple of years so the £80 per night (+ taxes) was acceptable when compared with other hotels in the city of a similar quality. I arranged a late check-out on my last day and had to pay half the daily room rate for an extra 6 hours use of the room - I thought that this was a bit expensive. Overall: Would I stay there again? Yes, if I wanted to be in that area of the city. If you're looking for a hotel with loads of facilities to keep the kids entertained then this might not be the place but for a good night's sleep at a reasonable price and in a decent location this hotel is well worth considering. Other stuff: A friend travelling with me had booked a smoking room but only found out at check-in that the hotel had gone completely no-smoking from January 2008 (the room was only booked a week before the no-smoking policy was implemented).

Reviews.Title: “Staff not very helpful”
Reviews.Author: totzys
Reviews.Content: Checked into this hotel through au.Hotels assuming I had booked a room to accomodate 2 adults and two teenagers, only to find it only had 2 single beds. The manager was not helpful, our choice, book another room at $1500 AU for 6 nights or hire a fold up bed at $70++ Sg per night, although there would not have been room for a fold up bed. The four of us attempted to sleep on 2 x single beds, some nights my husband slept on the floor. $1500 au for this.......with no breakfast, not worth it .Half way through our stay, the pungent smell of the Durian fruit came through our airconditioning. We had to pack and move floors. Reception staff were not friendly at all. The only good aspect of the hotel is the location, close to Dhouby Ghaut station.

Reviews.Title: “An average Hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: Bibster2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our pre and post trip to Bangkok in Dec/Jan. There's nothing great about this hotel except the location. Dhoby Ghaut MRT is about 5-7 minutes walk, Orchard Road where all the shopping is about 10-15minutes walk, Bugis is about 5-10 minutes. Everything is around this hotel. Staff are not very helpful and not flexible. Our room rate include breakfast for 2 but only 1 was allowed!!! The lady at the restaurant just refuse to let us in, so we had to run between the restaurant and the reception ourselves to clarify the deal, finally my husband was allowed in but found that it's not worth the running around as the food wasn't that great. For the next 3 mornings, we ended having our breakfast at "Kopitiam" opposite the hotel. It was yummy and lots of choices. Pool is nice and there are no chairs for you to sit at the lobby. You 'll see lots of people standing around!!! Lots of exits too from the hotel so can be confusing.. Overall, we had a great stay and because of the location and the reasonable rate, we will consider staying again minus the breakfast!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: MartynLondon
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of this Hotel was very poor as we were kept waiting for about 40 minutes as they could not find us a room even though this had been booked through a travel agent. There was no apology and the room we were eventually given was very small. During our stay the staff at reception were always unhelpful and inefficient. The location of the hotel was good, just a short walk from Raffles where you must visit the free museum. The best thing about the Rendezvous hotel was the Happy Hour Singapore Sling. Beware the bottled water in the room is not complementary.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: tog
Reviews.Content: Good location and reasonable standard of hotel. As stated in a previous review, the bottled water in the room is expensive (Evian instead of a more local water) and the wi-fi is only available at a daily rate - expensive if you only want to check your e-mails for 30 minutes. Breakfast buffet finishes at 10.30 PROMPT - everything is whisked away on the dot, so make sure you have taken everything you want by that time. Alternatively there are coffee shops very nearby along Bras Basah Road. The swimming pool is quite nice, but only about 10 sunbeds round it.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nomad93
Reviews.Content: Rendevous is located at a good location close to orchad road, China Town. I stayed at their premier room. The room was spacious and comfortable. Though i didnt care much for the bathroom floor which did not match with the bathroom walls and also the floor looked old and rundown. I had booked the room through their site. the price quoted is exclusive of taxes (something which they do not mention on their site. you have to call and confirm if the price includes taxes or not.) Overall an average experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but rules can't be bent....”
Reviews.Author: Away-From-Brussels
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked us at this hotel as part of a Singapore Airlines stopover. We had arrived early in the morning at around 7.45am and was told that checkin time was at 2pm. It was such a dissapointment. The indian lady was very apologetic and said that we could come between 11am-12pm to check if rooms were available. We were then directed to the pool to freshn' up. After we went to the pool, we went to the reception and ask if we could switch our last day breakfast to today but was told that they cannot. I was surprised as I am not asking for additional breakfast, only to change the dates. I even offered to pay the difference if the problem was due to money. Later the girl which attended to us earlier, checked with the restaurant. And came back saying NO. It was so ridiculous but instead, she gave a discount voucher for the reataurant and also showed me the areas where I could "buy" time while waiting for the room. The lobby was very small and there were no chairs to sit. Worse of all, its very hot. I notice that the counter had fans so I gathered that the aircon is low all the time. The rooms were small but adequite for the two of us. When my wife wanted to have a shower, we saw a few strands of hair in the toilet floor. If you are looking for hot water, this is not the hotel I was told that they maintain it at only 44 degrees. We approached the concierge to reserve our seats but she does not understand. (I think it was the concierge but she was not wearing unoform... then again I may be wrong.) I didn't know how to reserve seats thru' internet and had to approach the manager for assistance. She booked and also explained to us. (I think she was from India - very helpful.) Overall, my stay was wonderful. Will definately return to Rendezvous again. I forgot to mention, I got the room at 10.30am.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lynjane70
Reviews.Content: The Rendezvous was a perfect choice for location and value for money..........we had four days to spend in Singapore on the way home from Australia, and managed to see all the city highlights so easily from the ideal location of this Hotel. We could walk to Clarke Quay, China Town, Little India, the Marina, Mustapha & Suntec Malls very easily. Recommended is a visit to Chijmes for souvenirs and a lovely courtyard for dining day and night...just down the road, and across the road from Raffles Hotel. Orchard Road starts outside the Hotel, and other highlights were a cheap taxi fare away. Our room was clean, comfortable, with internet access...the staff were helpful, and there's a great pub on street level,as well as a nice pool...........everything you need at a reasonable price, we will go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but ok”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaTraveller
Reviews.Content: The room was pleasant enough if a bit on the small side, mainly due to the unwanted extra single bed in what was otherwise a standard double room. The location is very central and the facilities are generally reasonable. One annoyance was the bar closing at 11pm which in my book is not acceptable in a big hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at the Rendezvous Singapore!!!”
Reviews.Author: Unhappy_in_Singapore
Reviews.Content: This hotel has is absolutely terrible and ruined the trip. The front desk staff are unfriendly, unreliable and the hotel manager was confrontational when we escalated our issue for his help. My mother flew 25 hours from the US to be in Singapore for my wedding. Before picking her up at the airport, I personally called the hotel and checked to see if her room would be available. I was assured by the hotel staff that indeed her reservation was in place and that a room would be ready for her check-in when we arrived from the airport in 1 hour. When we arrived at the hotel, not only was her room not available but we also learned that a tour bus of 30 other people had just arrived before us and they also did not have rooms. After such a long flight, my mother wanted to take a shower and get some rest. The front desk staff were rude, unfriendly and unsympathetic. This is not the type of professionalism you expect from an upmarket hotel. It was only when I asked to speak to the hotel manager that anyone seemed to take interest. Upon meeting the hotel manager, he proceed to tell me that it was my fault. He then told us that it was our travel agents fault. For some reason, he did not seem to accept that someone from his staff had, only 1 hour earlier, confirmed that a room was available. Had we known a room wasn't available, we would not have dragged my mother across town to the hotel. We cut short my mother's stay at the Rendezvous and moved her to another hotel, the Miramar which was significantly better. I have stayed in hundreds of hotels and I was appalled by the service, attitude and accusations of the hotel staff at the Rendezvous. There are a lot of other hotels in Singapore - very good ones. I would strongly urge people considering this hotel to consider their alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrsladyeastanglia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rendezvous in August 2007 for 4 nights, yes the receptionist is lacking in humor or warmth, she did wined me up with her manner, otherwise staff were lovely very friendly and helpful. Room was not ready on arrival and they charged us another $60 a day for a rollaway for my small son, when we got past that our stay was brilliant the food was good and varied we enjoyed the pool and was glad it was in the shade (who wants full on sun?) We would stay there again only make sure of the price and any additions first next time.

Reviews.Title: “So-so only/Great location”
Reviews.Author: live÷e
Reviews.Content: Checked in late at night with no Bellman around the entrance of hotel. Guess I have disturbed the momentum of the front desk staff as they appeared to have "interesting chat" on the website they were on seconds before I arrived for check-in. Room was well maintained and immaculate, excellent job by the Housekeeping team. Ordered room service breakfast next morning and arrived 2 mins ahead of time requested, staff was more friendly and meal was well presented. Experience at check-out is more pleasant than the night before. Expect great and convenient location, don't expect excellence in service and you will have a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you get a good price”
Reviews.Author: Matelot2000
Reviews.Content: Part of the Clarion Collection so use their website to cross-check prices. I managed S$150+tax a night, which was a good rate. Rooms OK for size and comfort but well-serviced. Some things like bottled water (2xbotts=S$10) is extravangantly expensive. So is internet if you use their broadband - use their wireless ($S12 a day-register at reception) although speed varies wildly. Breakfast S$16 a person is good but you can get a simple breakfast at the Kopitam opposite for S$2.50 and lunch/dinner for less than S$10. Location is very good - close to Dhoby Gaut MRT and taxis are easy to obtain. Raffles is close and Chinatown is 20mins sweaty walk away. Altogether, if you get a good room price, go for it, but compare closely.

Reviews.Title: “practically located good but not excellent”
Reviews.Author: gachingura
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed at this hotel, I booked it again through an agent for a stop-over during my honeymoon, on our ways to and from Indonesia. The hotel is very practical to go everywhere in Singapore. The rooms cannot be faulted, in particular if yours is not on the street side. When we arrived we had to wait an hour for a room to be ready, which we thought was very bad, in particular after the intercontinental flight. We could use the pool facilities to have a was and get changed though, which was OK. The room was on the top floor and very quiet. We asked to be in the same room on the way back. The breakfast buffet is adequate but not great. On the whole this hotel gives very easy access to everything in Singapore, it's clean and confortable, but don't expect any luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: MuchLoveForTravel
Reviews.Content: We used to travel to Singapore almost on a monthly basis so we stayed at this hotel numerous times. Service is okay. Room is good for the price paid (corporate rate of ~$110US a night). But not all rooms have down comforters and I think they're the lower floors (below 6th floor). The deluxe room is just a bit (could hardly tell) bigger than the superior. Walking distance to a 24 hour food court, called Kopitiam. About a 15 min. walk to the subway. About a 20 min. walk to a shopping plaza, Plaza Singapura, which has a Carrefour (like a Wal-mart) and many shops and restaurants. Just few more mins further, you will hit Orchard Rd., where all the department stores and shops are located. Buses stop right at the back entrance of the hotel. There's also a DeliFrance next door. 7-11 store is right next door also. A very conveniently located hotel with comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller88
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed overnight in Singapore on our way to Paris, and this hotel looked to be a good choice, it was! Centraly located, beautiful room, lovely breakfast and the staff were exceptionally helpful. I think I would be hard pressed to find a better place to stay for the price in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok. I don't recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: ChunMingYang
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via travel agency and stayed there for three nights this week. The exterior of this hotel is quite appealing, looks like a nice 4-star hotel (that's what most Sigapore travel books said) BUT！Actually this hotel quality is a 3-star-quality hotel. My room is at lower level, faces to the Bras Basah Road. It's a little bit noisy in the night. The room is clean but don't expect various amenties. As another reviewer said, there is NO free bottle water in the room, you have to buy it at nearby convience stores. Broadband internet service are over-priced, you should consider more before connect your laptop. Breakfast buffet is unappealing, for a 4-star hotel, I expect more choices. Food is a little bit over-priced, you can find similar dishes in a Kopitam (food shop) located one-block away (2 mins from the hotel). Except these probelms, this hotel still has its advantages. Location is great, very close to MRT station, food shop, cafes, and many attractions (e.g., Orchard Road, City Hall, Raffles Hotel...etc). Staffs are quite nice and are willing to help customers. In short, Rendezvous Singapore is actually a 3-star hotel. Pay some extra money and stay another better place!

Reviews.Title: “Three strikes, so they are O-U-T”
Reviews.Author: JohninNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in mid-June 2007, and had booked for room + taxes+ breakfast though one of the Asian based reservation services. I paid in full in advance. The non-smoking room that I received was on a lower floor that reeked of tobacco: the corridor, the elevator car, and my room too. All day long, there were foul cooking smells coming up from the kitchen, like boarding house cabbage and beans. The hotel offered no complimentary bottled water, a first for me even in Singapore hotels. Large sizes of the bottled water on the desk, though, were available for purchase. The buffet breakfast was unappealing and offered few choices: a meager setting in a town known for food. Well, that the three strikes. They are now out of my book; I'll stay elsewhere when I return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Locationand the price is right”
Reviews.Author: HongLam
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights on the way back home (Aus) after 2 weeks in Vietnam, We' got 3 deluxe rooms with 145Au$/room.When we checked in, a front desk staff who seem didnt how to smile do the check-in procedure which took quite a long time,when asked " Is there any wrong with our reserves ( We paid our stay already pre-trip) , she just looked up, still no smile and a "NO". That's it, We though we were still in Vietnam!! Despite that girl, all other staffs are friendly and helpful. The room is big enough for a couple and the closet/ storage' space big enough for our bags( We bought heap of stuffs during our holiday in VN)Room is clean,and the pool is a bonus for my kid due to hot weather in Sing. The hotel location is perfect since it locate next to Dhoby Ghaut MRT and the Kopitiam is nearby. Wander along the Bencoleen st, we found many eating place with cheap price and good food Very convenience for an early or a late meal.

Reviews.Title: “The Rendezvous is OK”
Reviews.Author: L8H
Reviews.Content: We were in Singapore for 3 days before flying onto Penang and this was the first time. We arrived into Singapore very early in the morning and we were at the hotel at around 09:00. Unfortunately they did not have a room for us until one o'clock. After a little bit of silence i asked whether it would be possible to have access to the gym or swiming pool so we could shower and change our clothes which we were given but might have been nice to have been offered this. When we did check in there was no bed for our daughter who was traveling with us, although the hotel blamed this on our travel agent. The chap that checked us in wasnt going out of his way to help us, he did however provide and additional bed at now extra charge. The hotel is clean, in a good location with a 10 minute walk to the MRT station, Raffles and Orchard Road. Whether it was because of our 15 hours of travelling and day walking around Singapore but the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The rooms are average size leaning towards small. Although I probably would stay here again i think I would try another for comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Leighcote
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel which lived up to our expectations. We had double room booked on the non-smoking (8th) floor which had great views of the city. The room was spacious and very clean. Breakfast buffet was excellent - a mixture of local and European food. Nearest Metro station is only a 10 minute walk away. We will definitely pay a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: emski78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location - not far from one of the metro stops. And also not far from Raffles Hotel (in walking distance). It is at one end of Orchard Road so not right in the middle of things, but it is easy and quick enough to get to Orchard Road by underground train. The hotel itself was very clean, and of a good standard. Very good facilities. We had a double standard room, which was fine, and provided everything we needed as tourists. I wouldn't call it luxurious, but it was certainly above average. Very pleasant stay here. Everything ran smoothly from check in. I would recommend this hotel to anyone with a short (or long) stopover in Sinagpore. There is also an excellent food court nearby (next block along) should you wish to sample some of the local cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Expected Better!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shiv'sTrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel in Jan 07 Location ok but rooms very dark and bathrooms not very clean, Really Need Major Renovation! Leaking ceiling my my room(deluxe room)which took 1 day to fix after complaining few times Staff not very friendly,Shocking!!! I will never go back again. Shivani Sydney Australia

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected, but possibly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: nomixer
Reviews.Content: I was asked to work in Singapore for 3 months for work at very short notice, so booked the Rendezvous for my first week as it was convenient for both the office and nightlife. I chose my flight specifically as it arrived around 2.30pm so that I would not have any delays checking in. Within 5 mins of getting out of the taxi I had checked in on the executive floor, been given a brief overview of the facilities, and arrived at my room where the porter was waiting with my bag. The room had plenty of storage (I had clothes for a 3 month trip), an average sized, clean bathroom as well as a proper desk. There was also an armchair to sit at while snacking on the complimentary fruit basket. As a business traveller I was pleased to note that the desk had plenty of power sockets and all were multi region, so I could plug my US laptop in without having to use an adaptor. The internet access was charged at $0.85 a minute, or a maximum charge of $25 for 24 hours. Annoyingly the TV remote control could not be used to turn the TV on or off, and the picture broke up on certain channels, but that was only a minor issue. I didn't have occaision to use any of the hotel's other facilities, such as the pool or restaurants, so cannot advise on those. My only other previous experience of Singapore was a 2 night stopover nearly 2 years ago to the day. I stayed at 5* hotel just off Orchard Road for about two thirds of the cost of the Rendezvous, so it would seem that the hotel rates have gone up a lot in recent years. I would stay here again if I found a better rate than the approx 90GBP I paid.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in January. We found the hotel quite comfortable and in a convenient neighborhood close to a metro station. Do check out the Fortune Center a couple of blocks away -- it is an unassuming looking building, but go up a couple of floors and there is a very interesting selection of massage, astrology and chiropractic businesses that we found fascinating. We used the hotel's tour service and were happy with that. There is also an excellent coffee place next door. I can't think of anything negative to say about the Rendezvous, and we would definitely stay here again if we return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Trav3l
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rendezvous Hotel in mid-December of 2006. We checked in at 1pm but they were unable to get us a room until 2pm so we had to wait in the lobby for a bit. So when they gave us our room key at 2pm, we went upstairs to our room and the lady was still cleaning so we had to wait in the hallway while she finished up. Not sure if there is some sort of communication problem there but when they say we can check-in by 2pm, I expect to check-in hassle free by that time. Although they checked us into a non-smoking room, there was definitely a smoke odor so we had to change rooms. The room was decent with a nice view but the shower was very disappointing. We had the tap turned to the hottest setting and that was just barely comfortable enough. The hotel was within walking distance to the subway and had a bunch of restaurants nearby for lunch/dinner. We would stay there again despite the hassles that we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Very acceptable”
Reviews.Author: theoldwoman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights at the end of November. We booked via the Rendezvous Hotel group’s own website, chose a room on the 7th floor, and requested a room away from the main road, which we were given, so top marks to the check-in staff. Our room was well fitted with good aircon, and kept very clean. The staff were friendly and helpful, with advice on transport etc.. The hotel is in a great location, from the pavement outside you can catch a bus to almost anywhere in southern Singapore, and just a block away is the Dobi Ghaut MTR station. Bras Basah road changes into Orchard Road outside the hotel, so if not too hot you can walk to all the shopping malls. Raffles hotel is an easy walk, useful after a few Singapore Slings in the Long Bar! I bought one day’s wifi from the hotel for SGD11.60, before I discovered that the Olympic Centre one block away offers completely free wifi 24x7 – and there’s a Starbucks there too, where the staff are very friendly and helpful. In fact everyone in Singapore was friendly, some a little too friendly, avoid being tempted into conversation by the tailors in Chinatown, or before you know it you’ll have ordered a suit and half a dozen shirts. We never ate in the hotel, as there’s a Kopitiam food court right next door, for great value breakfast, lunch, and dinner, with about a dozen different Asian cuisines on offer. We’d definitely stay there again; good rooms, helpful staff, great value and great location.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jltaylor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is less than 5 minutes walk from a metro station. The breakfast buffet had a decent variety of both eastern and western foods. My room was slightly on the small side, but not overly cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alijax
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel. I found the Clarion to be very clean and the staff friendly. The hotel is located near the subway line and I found it easy to navigate to and from the area. Little India is in walking distance and the nearest halker stand is only a block away (where the food is cheap) !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HeatherAitken
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel after a nine hour flight from London and we were dealt with very efficiently and professionally. We had a three night stop over there before travelling on to Australia. Hotel room was nice with everything we desired. We did not eat in the hotel however we did look at the menu and everything appeared reasonably priced. Singapore itself is beautiful - everything is so clean and the people are so disciplined and make you very welcome. We had a trip to Sentosa Island - again beautiful (although the guide was a bit of Sergeant Major and we didn't have an awful lot of time to do our own thing). We also went on the Whacky Duck ride which gave us a tour of the city and then a sail down the river. We went to Raffles for a "Singapore Sling" and although it was expensive it was something you just had to do. We weren't leaving Singapore until early evening and we had to check out at 12.00. We were given another room until we left (at no extra charge). We spent a couple of hours at the pool and spa before travelling and because this was deserted we were perfectly chilled out before leaving. The bar staff were also very friendly and informative. All in all I would not hesitate to use this hotel again. It was a perfect start to a perfect holiday.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: LisaT
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 2 night stay at the Rendezvous. We booked through Asiarooms.com which gave a great rate plus buffet breakfast. The location was excellent. 10 minutes walk to just about anywhere we wanted to go, Clarke Quay, Little India, Arab St. Dhoby Ghaut MRT is a few hundred yards away so we jumped on that for Chinatown and Newton. The rooms were very clean and ours was spacious with lots of amenities. The staff we lovely. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Rendezvous Hotel Singapore
HotelInfo.Address: 9 Bras Basah Road, Singapore 189559, Singapore
